description: The user of Sky Attack will become cloaked in a harsh light on the first turn. On the second turn, Sky Attack deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).. It also has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24).

If the user is holding a Power Herb, Sky Attack executes in one turn. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor, or those under the effects of Lucky Chant, are protected against critical hits.
In Pokémon Let's Go Pikachu & Let's Go Eevee, Sky Attack has 200 base power.
In Generations 1-2, Sky Attack does not have an increased critical hit rate.
When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sky Attack turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 200.

Sucker Punch.name: Sucker Punch
description: Sucker Punch deals damage and has a priority of +1. However, the move only works if the target uses a direct attack in the same turn. If the target is not preparing an attack, Sucker Punch will fail.
Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.
In Generations 4-6, Sucker Punch has 80 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sucker Punch turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 140.

Super Fang.name: Super Fang
description: Always takes off half of the opponent's HP.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Super Fang turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

Hyper Fang.name: Hyper Fang
description: Hyper Fang deals damage and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).
Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyper Fang turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.

Final Gambit.name: Final Gambit
description: Inflicts damage equal to the user's remaining HP. User faints.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Final Gambit turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 180.

Flame Wheel.name: Flame Wheel
description: Flame Wheel deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target.
Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.
If the user is frozen, Flame Wheel can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking.
In Generations 2-3, Flame Wheel is categorized as Special.
When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flame Wheel turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 120.

Fury Swipes.name: Fury Swipes
description: Fury Swipes hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.
Each strike of Fury Swipes is treated like a separate attack:
Each strike can get a critical hit independently.
Abilities that activate on contact (Static, Weak Armor, Iron Barbs etc.) activate for each strike.
If the Sturdy ability, Focus Sash, or Focus Band activates before the final hit, the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the opponent to faint.
If the first hit breaks a Substitute, the second hit will deal damage to the target Pokémon.
The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.
The Skill Link ability will cause Fury Swipes to always hit the maximum number of times.
In Generations 2-4, if a Focus Sash or Focus Band activates before the final hit, subsequent hits do not cause the holder to faint.
In Generations 1-3, Fury Swipes ends immediately if any hit breaks a Substitute.
In Generation 1, each hit will always deal the same damage - if the first critical hits, so will the rest.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fury Swipes turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

Last Resort.name: Last Resort
description: Last Resort deals high damage, but will fail if the user has not used each of its other moves at least once (or has no other moves). If the user switches out, the move gets reset and when it switches back in, will need to use each of its other moves at least once in order to use Last Resort again.
In Generation 4, Last Resort has 130 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Last Resort turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 200.
When Eevee is holding Eevium Z and uses its Z-Power, Last Resort turns into Extreme Evoboost.

Revenge.name: Revenge
description: Power increases if user was hit first.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Revenge turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120.

Reversal.name: Reversal
description: Reversal deals more damage the lower the user's HP is, as per the table below.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Reversal turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 160.

Screech.name: Screech
description: Screech lowers the target's Defense by two stages.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Screech turns into Z-Screech and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Taunt.name: Taunt
description: Taunt prevents the target from using Status-category moves for three turns.
Clobbopus evolves into Grapploct after learning Taunt - learnt at level 35.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Taunt turns into Z-Taunt and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Thunderbolt.name: Thunderbolt
description: Thunderbolt deals damage and has a 10% chance of paralyzing the target.
Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
In Generations 1-5, Thunderbolt has 95 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunderbolt turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 175.
When Alolan Raichu is holding Aloraichium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunderbolt turns into Stoked Sparksurfer and has base power 175.
When Pikachu in a cap is holding Pikashunium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunderbolt turns into 10,000,000 Volt Thunderbolt and has base power 195.

Thunder.name: Thunder
description: Thunder deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target.
Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
If used during rain, Thunder ignores accuracy. Conversely, if used during intense sunlight, its accuracy drops to 50%.
Thunder can hit Pokémon during the first stage of Bounce, Fly or Sky Drop.
In Generations 1-5, Thunder has 120 base power.
In Diamond/Pearl only, Thunder has a 30% chance of breaking through Protect or Detect during rain.
In Generation 1, the chance of paralysis is 10%.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunder turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 185.

Shock Wave.name: Shock Wave
description: Shock Wave deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shock Wave turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 120.

Charge Beam.name: Charge Beam
description: Charge Beam deals damage and has a 70% chance of raising the user's Special Attack by one stage.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Charge Beam turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 100.

Thunder Wave.name: Thunder Wave
description: Thunder Wave paralyzes the opponent. Paralyzed Pokémon have a 25% chance of not being able to attack, and their Speed is decreased by 50% (75% in Generations 1-6).
Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
In Generations 1-6, Thunder Wave has 100% accuracy.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunder Wave turns into Z-Thunder Wave and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Leer.name: Leer
description: Leer lowers the target's Defense by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leer turns into Z-Leer and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Drill Peck.name: Drill Peck
description: Drill Peck deals damage with no additional effect, besides being able to hit non-adjacent Pokémon in triple battles.
When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Drill Peck turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 160.

Astonish.name: Astonish
description: Astonish deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).
Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
In Generation 3 if the target has used Minimize, Astonish deals double damage.
When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Astonish turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 100.

Tri Attack.name: Tri Attack
description: Tri Attack deals damage and has a 20% chance of paralyzing, burning or freezing the target - i.e. a 6.67% chance of each status condition.

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen.
In Generations 1-3, Tri Attack is categorized as Physical.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tri Attack turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.

Wrap.name: Wrap
description: Wrap inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns.
If the user holds a Grip Claw, the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1⁄6 of the target's maximum HP.
In Generations 1-4, Wrap has 85% accuracy.
In Generations 1-4, the after-effects of Wrap last for 2-5 turns instead of 4-5; holding Grip Claw they last for 5 turns.
In Generations 2-5, the target loses only 1⁄16 of their maximum HP after each turn, or 1⁄8 if a Binding Band is held.
In Generation 1, Wrap inflicts regular damage for 2-5 turns. While in effect, the target is unable to attack.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wrap turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

Glare.name: Glare
description: Glare paralyzes the target, if it hits. Paralyzed Pokémon have a 25% chance of not being able to attack, and their Speed is decreased by 50% (75% in Generations 1-6).
Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
In Generations 1-4, Glare has 75% accuracy.
In Generation 5, Glare has 90% accuracy.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Glare turns into Z-Glare and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Acid.name: Acid
description: Acid deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
In Generations 1-3, Acid is categorized as Physical.
In Generations 1-3, Acid may lower Defense instead. (This is likely because Acid is a Physical move in those games.)
In Generation 1, Acid has a 33.2% chance of lowering Defense, while in Generations 2-3 it has a 10% chance.
When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Acid turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 100.

Spit Up.name: Spit Up
description: Spit Up deals varying damage depending on how many times the user used Stockpile. The base power is 100, 200 or 300 if the user stockpiled one, two or three times respectively.
Spit Up also removes the Defense and Special Defense boosts given through Stockpile.
In Generation 3, Spit Up is categorized as Physical.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spit Up turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

Stockpile.name: Stockpile
description: Stockpile raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each and charges up power for use with companion moves Spit Up or Swallow. Stockpile can be used up to three times before its companion moves, which will attack or recover HP respectively.
The power of Spit Up and HP gained from Swallow varies depending on how many times Stockpile was used. After one of those moves is used, the user loses the Defense and Special Defense boosts.
In Generation 3, Stockpile has 10 PP.
In Generation 3, it does not increase Defense nor Special Defense.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Stockpile turns into Z-Stockpile and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Swallow.name: Swallow
description: Swallow recovers a varying amount of HP depending on how many times the user has used Stockpile. It recovers 25%, 50% or 100% of the user's maximum HP if the user stockpiled one, two or three times respectively.
Swallow also removes the Defense and Special Defense boosts given through Stockpile.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Swallow turns into Z-Swallow and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Acid Spray.name: Acid Spray
description: Acid Spray inflicts damage and lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Acid Spray turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 100.

Gastro Acid.name: Gastro Acid
description: Cancels out the effect of the opponent's Ability.
When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gastro Acid turns into Z-Gastro Acid and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Belch.name: Belch
description: Belch deals damage, but only works if the user has previously consumed a Berry during the battle. Manually feeding a Berry from the bag does not count.
When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Belch turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 190.

Coil.name: Coil
description: Coil raises the user's Attack, Defense and Accuracy by one stage each.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Coil turns into Z-Coil and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Gunk Shot.name: Gunk Shot
description: Gunk Shot deals damage and has a 30% chance of poisoning the target.
Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.
In Generations 4-5, Gunk Shot has 70% accuracy.
When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gunk Shot turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 190.

Slam.name: Slam
description: Slam deals damage with no additional effect.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Slam turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.

Disable.name: Disable
description: Disable causes the previous move the target used to be disabled for 1-8 turns, which prevents the move's use.
In Generations 1-3, Disable has 55% accuracy.
In Generation 4, Disable has 80% accuracy.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Disable turns into Z-Disable and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Poison Fang.name: Poison Fang
description: Poison Fang deals damage and has a 50% chance of badly poisoning the target. Badly poisoned Pokémon will lose an increasing amount of HP at the end of each turn.
In Generations 3-5, Poison Fang has a 30% chance of badly poisoning the target.
When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Poison Fang turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 100.

Poison Tail.name: Poison Tail
description: Poison Tail deals damage and has a 10% chance of poisoning the target. It also has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24).
Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.
When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Poison Tail turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 100.

Spite.name: Spite
description: The opponent's last move loses 2-5 PP.
When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spite turns into Z-Spite and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Switcheroo.name: Switcheroo
description: Switcheroo switches held items with the target. It does not require both Pokémon to be holding an item, in which case the item is simply given to the target or received from it.

Switching items with wild Pokémon is permanent (received items are kept, given items are lost). All held items in Trainer battles and wi-fi/linked battles (including Battle Tower/Subway/Maison) are returned to their respective owners at the end of a battle.

Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon.
In Generation 4, switching items with a Trainer's Pokémon is also permanent, but Switcheroo will fail if used by a wild Pokémon or a Trainer's Pokémon.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Switcheroo turns into Z-Switcheroo and raises Speed two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Torment.name: Torment
description: Opponent cannot use the same move in a row.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Torment turns into Z-Torment and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Ice Fang.name: Ice Fang
description: Ice Fang deals damage, has a 10% chance of freezing the target and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).
Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Fang turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 120.

Thunder Fang.name: Thunder Fang
description: Thunder Fang deals damage, has a 10% chance of paralyzing the target, and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).
Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunder Fang turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 120.

Nasty Plot.name: Nasty Plot
description: Nasty Plot raises the user's Special Attack by two stages.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Nasty Plot turns into Z-Nasty Plot and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Nuzzle.name: Nuzzle
description: Nuzzle deals damage and paralyzes the target. Paralyzed Pokémon have a 25% chance of not being able to attack, and their Speed is decreased by 50% (75% in Generations 1-6).
Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Nuzzle turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 100.

Play Nice.name: Play Nice
description: Play Nice lowers the target's Attack by one stage. The move always hits, even if the target used a Protect-like move.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Play Nice turns into Z-Play Nice and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Sweet Kiss.name: Sweet Kiss
description: Sweet Kiss causes the target to become confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack.
Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
In Generations 2-5, Sweet Kiss is a Normal-type move.
When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sweet Kiss turns into Z-Sweet Kiss and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Thunder Shock.name: Thunder Shock
description: Thunder Shock deals damage and has a 10% chance of paralyzing the target.
Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
In Generations 1-5, this move's name is formatted as ThunderShock.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunder Shock turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 100.

Electro Ball.name: Electro Ball
description: Electro Ball inflicts more damage the faster the user is compared to the opponent. The table shows the different base powers for each ratio, where r = UserSpeed ÷ TargetSpeed
For example, if the user's Speed is at least 3 times more than the target but less than 4 times, Electro Ball hits with 120 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Electro Ball turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 160.

Feint.name: Feint
description: Feint only hits if the target used Protect or Detect in the same turn. It also cancels Protect/Detect for the remainder of the turn, so subsequent moves in the same turn (in double/triple battles) can still hit.
In Generation 4, Feint has 50 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Feint turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

Spark.name: Spark
description: Spark deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target.
Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
In Generations 2-3, Spark is categorized as Special.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spark turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 120.

Discharge.name: Discharge
description: Discharge deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target(s).
Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Discharge turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 160.

Charge.name: Charge
description: Charge raises the user's Special Defense by one stage, and if this Pokémon's next move is a damage-dealing Electric-type attack, it will deal double damage.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
In Generation 3, Charge does not raise Special Defense.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Charge turns into Z-Charge and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Disarming Voice.name: Disarming Voice
description: Disarming Voice deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.
When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Disarming Voice turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 100.

Electric Terrain.name: Electric Terrain
description: Electric Terrain creates a low-lying electric field lasting 5 turns, that prevents grounded Pokémon from falling asleep. The power of Electric type moves also increases by 50% while in effect.
Grounded Pokémon are simply those that are not raised. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary.
Electric Terrain is a terrain condition and can coexist at the same time as weather conditions, but not other terrain conditions.
The move Nature Power turns into Thunderbolt under Electric Terrain.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Electric Terrain turns into Z-Electric Terrain and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Encore.name: Encore
description: Encore forces the target to use the previously selected move for 3 turns.
Encore does not work against Encore itself, Mimic, Mirror Move, Sketch, Struggle or Transform.
In Generations 2-3 and Diamond/Pearl, it lasts for 2-6 turns. In Platinum/HeartGold/SoulSilver it lasts for 3-7 turns.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Encore turns into Z-Encore and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Present.name: Present
description: Either deals damage or heals.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Present turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

Tickle.name: Tickle
description: Tickle lowers the target's Attack and Defense by one stage each.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tickle turns into Z-Tickle and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Wish.name: Wish
description: The user recovers HP in the following turn.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wish turns into Z-Wish and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Baby-Doll Eyes.name: Baby-Doll Eyes
description: Baby-Doll Eyes lowers the target's Attack by one stage, with increased priority.
When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Baby-Doll Eyes turns into Z-Baby-Doll Eyes and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Calm Mind.name: Calm Mind
description: Calm Mind raises the user's Special Attack and Special Defense by one stage each.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Calm Mind turns into Z-Calm Mind and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Play Rough.name: Play Rough
description: Play Rough deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Attack by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Play Rough turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 175.
When Mimikyu is holding Mimikium Z and uses its Z-Power, Play Rough turns into Let's Snuggle Forever and has base power 190.

Volt Tackle.name: Volt Tackle
description: Volt Tackle deals damage and has a 10% chance of paralyzing the target, but the user receives 1⁄3 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 90 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 30 HP.
In Generation 3, Volt Tackle is categorized as Special.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Volt Tackle turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 190.
When Pikachu is holding Pikanium Z and uses its Z-Power, Volt Tackle turns into Catastropika and has base power 210.

Wild Charge.name: Wild Charge
description: Wild Charge deals damage, but the user receives 1⁄4 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 25 HP.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wild Charge turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 175.

Volt Switch.name: Volt Switch
description: User must switch out after attacking.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Volt Switch turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 140.

Defense Curl.name: Defense Curl
description: Defense Curl raises the user's Defense by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
After Defense Curl has been used at least once and while the user stays in battle, the power of Rollout and Ice Ball is double their regular base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Defense Curl turns into Z-Defense Curl and raises Accuracy one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Rollout.name: Rollout
description: Rollout deals damage for 5 turns, doubling in power each turn. The move stops if it misses on any turn. If it doesn't miss, Rollout will deal 30, 60, 120, 240 and 480 base power damage each turn respectively.
If the user has used Defense Curl in any previous turn (without switching out) then Rollout doubles in power, i.e. it will deal 60, 120, 240, 480 and 960 base power damage respectively.

As Rollout has 90% accuracy, the chances of it being successful for each turn (with normal Accuracy/Evasion and no other interruptions) are 90%, 81%, 73%, 66% and 59% respectively. In other words, roughly 3 out of every 5 times Rollout is used, it will hit for the full 5 turns.
Lickitung evolves into Lickilicky after learning Rollout - learnt at level 33.
When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rollout turns into Continental Crush and has base power 100.

Sandstorm.name: Sandstorm
description: Sandstorm creates a sandstorm on the battlefield that lasts for 5 turns and induces these additional effects:
All Pokémon lose 1⁄16 of their max HP at the end of each turn, except Ground, Rock and Steel types and those with the Magic Guard, Overcoat, Sand Force, Sand Rush or Sand Veil abilities.
From Generation 4 onward, the Special Defense of Rock-type Pokémon is increased by 50%.
The move Shore Up recovers 2⁄3 of the user's max HP (instead of 1⁄2).
The power of Solar Beam and Solar Blade decreases by 50%.
The moves Synthesis, Morning Sun and Moonlight recover 1⁄4 of the user's max HP (instead of the usual 1⁄2 HP).
The move Weather Ball changes to Rock type and doubles in power.
Pokémon with the ability Sand Force increase the power of Rock, Ground and Steel type moves by 30%.
Pokémon with the ability Sand Rush double their speed.
Pokémon with the ability Sand Veil increase their evasion by 20%.
When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sandstorm turns into Z-Sandstorm and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Powder Snow.name: Powder Snow
description: Powder Snow deals damage and has a 10% chance of freezing the target.
Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen.
When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Powder Snow turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 100.

Iron Head.name: Iron Head
description: Iron Head deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).
Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Iron Head turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 160.

Crush Claw.name: Crush Claw
description: Crush Claw deals damage and has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Defense by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Crush Claw turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.

Hone Claws.name: Hone Claws
description: Hone Claws raises the user's Attack and Accuracy by one stage each.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hone Claws turns into Z-Hone Claws and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Mud Shot.name: Mud Shot
description: Mud Shot deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
In Generation 3, Mud Shot is categorized as Physical.
When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mud Shot turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 100.

Mud-Slap.name: Mud-Slap
description: Mud-Slap deals damage and lowers the target's Accuracy by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
In Generations 2-3, Mud-Slap is categorized as Physical.
When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mud-Slap turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 100.

Night Slash.name: Night Slash
description: Night Slash deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24).
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Night Slash turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 140.

Steel Roller.name: Steel Roller
description: The user attacks while destroying the terrain. This move fails when the ground hasn’t turned into a terrain.
Steel Roller is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.

Triple Axel.name: Triple Axel
description: A consecutive three-kick attack that becomes more powerful with each successful hit.
Triple Axel is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.

Stealth Rock.name: Stealth Rock
description: Stealth Rock lays a trap of stones around the foe, which hurts Pokémon switching in to the opposing field. The rocks inflict variable damage — a fraction of the Pokémon's maximum HP, based on its susceptibility to the Rock type, as shown in the table.

For example, a Fighting type switching in would lose 1⁄16 their maximum HP since Rock is not very effective against it. A Fire/Flying type would lose 1⁄2 their HP since Rock is super-effective against both Fire and Flying.
Stealth Rock can be cleared from the field by the moves Rapid Spin (around the user) or Defog (around the target).
These are the worst Pokémon to switch in on a Stealth Rock trap:
#006 Charizard
#012 Butterfree
#123 Scyther
#144 Articuno
#146 Moltres
#165 Ledyba
#166 Ledian
#193 Yanma
#225 Delibird
#250 Ho Oh
#267 Beautifly
#284 Masquerain
#291 Ninjask
#414 Mothim
#415 Combee
#416 Vespiquen
#469 Yanmega
#636 Larvesta
#637 Volcarona
#662 Fletchinder
#663 Talonflame
#666 Vivillon
#741 Oricorio (Baile Style)
When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Stealth Rock turns into Z-Stealth Rock and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Sand Tomb.name: Sand Tomb
description: Sand Tomb inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns.
If the user holds a Grip Claw, the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1⁄6 of the target's maximum HP.
In Generations 3-4, Sand Tomb has 15 base power.
In Generations 3-4, Sand Tomb has 70% accuracy.
In Generations 3-4, the after-effects of Sand Tomb last for 2-5 turns instead of 4-5; holding Grip Claw they last for 5 turns.
In Generations 3-5, the target loses only 1⁄16 of their maximum HP after each turn, or 1⁄8 if a Binding Band is held.
When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sand Tomb turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 100.

Icicle Crash.name: Icicle Crash
description: Icicle Crash deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).
Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Icicle Crash turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 160.

Icicle Spear.name: Icicle Spear
description: Icicle Spear hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.
Each strike of Icicle Spear is treated like a separate attack:
Each strike can get a critical hit independently.
Abilities that activate on contact (Static, Weak Armor, Iron Barbs etc.) activate for each strike.
If the Sturdy ability, Focus Sash, or Focus Band activates before the final hit, the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the opponent to faint.
If the first hit breaks a Substitute, the second hit will deal damage to the target Pokémon.
The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.
The Skill Link ability will cause Icicle Spear to always hit the maximum number of times.
In Generation 3, Icicle Spear is categorized as Special.
In Generations 3-4, Icicle Spear has 10 base power.
In Generations 3-4, if a Focus Sash or Focus Band activates before the final hit, subsequent hits do not cause the holder to faint.
In Generation 3, Icicle Spear ends immediately if any hit breaks a Substitute.
When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Icicle Spear turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 140.

Metal Burst.name: Metal Burst
description: Deals damage equal to 1.5x opponent's attack.
When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Metal Burst turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 100.

Stone Edge.name: Stone Edge
description: Stone Edge deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24).
When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Stone Edge turns into Continental Crush and has base power 180.
When Lycanroc is holding Lycanium Z and uses its Z-Power, Stone Edge turns into Splintered Stormshards and has base power 190.

Double Kick.name: Double Kick
description: Double Kick deals damage and will strike twice (with 30 base power each time).
Each strike of Double Kick is treated like a separate attack:
Each strike can get a critical hit independently.
Abilities that activate on contact (Static, Weak Armor, Iron Barbs etc.) activate for each strike.
If the Sturdy ability, Focus Sash, or Focus Band activates before the final hit, the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the opponent to faint.
If the first hit breaks a Substitute, the second hit will deal damage to the target Pokémon.
The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.
In Generations 2-4, if a Focus Sash or Focus Band activates before the final hit, subsequent hits do not cause the holder to faint.
In Generations 1-3, Double Kick ends immediately if any hit breaks a Substitute.
In Generation 1, each hit will always deal the same damage - if the first critical hits, so will the rest.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Double Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.

Flatter.name: Flatter
description: Flatter confuses the target, and raises its Special Attack by one stage.

If one of the two effects cannot be invoked (for example the target is already confused or its Special Attack already raised to the maximum of +6 stages), Flatter still works and will invoke the other effect.

Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flatter turns into Z-Flatter and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Venom Drench.name: Venom Drench
description: If the target is poisoned, Venom Drench lowers its Attack, Special Attack and Speed by one stage each.
When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Venom Drench turns into Z-Venom Drench and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Sludge Wave.name: Sludge Wave
description: Sludge Wave deals damage and has a 10% chance of poisoning the target.
Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.
When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sludge Wave turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 175.

Superpower.name: Superpower
description: Superpower deals damage but lowers the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each after attacking.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Superpower turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 190.

Pay Day.name: Pay Day
description: A small amount of money is gained after the battle resolves.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Pay Day turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

Rock Blast.name: Rock Blast
description: Rock Blast hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.
Each strike of Rock Blast is treated like a separate attack:
Each strike can get a critical hit independently.
Abilities that activate on contact (Static, Weak Armor, Iron Barbs etc.) activate for each strike.
If the Sturdy ability, Focus Sash, or Focus Band activates before the final hit, the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the opponent to faint.
If the first hit breaks a Substitute, the second hit will deal damage to the target Pokémon.
The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.
The Skill Link ability will cause Rock Blast to always hit the maximum number of times.
In Generations 3-4, Rock Blast has 80% accuracy.
In Generations 3-4, if a Focus Sash or Focus Band activates before the final hit, subsequent hits do not cause the holder to faint.
In Generation 3, Rock Blast ends immediately if any hit breaks a Substitute.
When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Blast turns into Continental Crush and has base power 140.

Hex.name: Hex
description: Hex inflicts damage, but if the target has a major status ailment (i.e. is burned, poisoned, paralyzed, asleep or frozen) it will double in power to 130.
In Generation 5, Hex has 50 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hex turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 160.

High Horsepower.name: High Horsepower
description: The user fiercely attacks the target using its entire body.
When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, High Horsepower turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 175.

Throat Chop.name: Throat Chop
description: Throat Chop deals damage and prevents the target from using sound-based moves such as Hyper Voice for two turns.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Throat Chop turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160.

Horn Attack.name: Horn Attack
description: Horn Attack deals damage with no additional effect.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Horn Attack turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 120.

Head Smash.name: Head Smash
description: Head Smash deals damage, but the user receives 1⁄2 of the damage it inflicts in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 50 HP.
When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Head Smash turns into Continental Crush and has base power 200.

Horn Drill.name: Horn Drill
description: If it hits, Horn Drill is guaranteed to make the opponent faint. Its accuracy increases if the user is a higher level than the target Pokémon, but fails if the target is higher level.
Its accuracy (as a percentage) is calculated as below, ignoring all other accuracy and evasion modifiers:
This means that if the user and target Pokémon are the same level, Horn Drill has 30% accuracy.
In Generation 1, Horn Drill has 30% accuracy.
In Generation 1, Horn Drill can hit Pokémon of any level, but does not affect Pokémon with a higher Speed than the user.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Horn Drill turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 180.

Thrash.name: Thrash
description: The user of Thrash attacks for 2-3 turns, during which it cannot switch out, and then becomes confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack.
If Thrash is disrupted (e.g. if the move misses or the user cannot attack due to paralysis) then it will stop and not cause confusion.
Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
In Generations 1-4, Thrash has 90 base power.
In Generations 1-4, Thrash has 20 PP.
In Generations 1-4, the sleep, freezing and flinching status effects will pause but not disrupt Thrash.
In Generation 1, Thrash lasts for 3-4 turns.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thrash turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190.

Smart Strike.name: Smart Strike
description: The user stabs the target with a sharp horn. This attack never misses.
When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Smart Strike turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 140.

Megahorn.name: Megahorn
description: Megahorn deals damage with no additional effect.
When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Megahorn turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 190.

Copycat.name: Copycat
description: Copies opponent's last move.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Copycat turns into Z-Copycat and raises Accuracy one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Pound.name: Pound
description: Pound deals damage with no additional effect.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Pound turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

Sing.name: Sing
description: Sing puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns.
Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sing turns into Z-Sing and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Splash.name: Splash
description: Doesn't do ANYTHING.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Splash turns into Z-Splash and raises Attack three stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Stored Power.name: Stored Power
description: Stored Power deals varying damage based on the user's stat increases. It starts at base power 20 and increases by 20 for each net stat boost the user has received, including Evasion and Accuracy. In other words the power is:
For example, if the Pokémon used Dragon Dance and Double Team once each, that is a total of 3 stat increases (+1 Attack, +1 Speed, +1 Evasion) and Stored Power's base power will be 20 × 3 + 20 = 80.

The maximum it could reach (although impractical) if all stats are fully boosted is 20 × 6 × 7 + 20 = a massive 860 base power. (This does not include other boosts - here the Pokémon would have a +6 Special Attack boost meaning a 4× multiplier, plus STAB for most of the Pokémon that can learn Stored Power.)
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Stored Power turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160.

Minimize.name: Minimize
description: Minimize raises the user's Evasion by two stages, thus making the user more difficult to hit. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
The following moves deal double damage against a Pokémon that has used Minimize, and bypass accuracy checks:
Body Slam
Dragon Rush
Flying Press
Heat Crash
Heavy Slam
Malicious Moonsault (Z-Move)
Steamroller
Stomp
In Generations 1-5, Minimize has 20 PP.
In Generations 1-2 a Pokémon that has used Minimize is shown with a tiny sprite, until they faint or switch out.
In Generations 1-4 Minimize only raises Evasion one stage.
In Generations 1-5 the accuracy bypass for the double-damage moves does not occur.

Across generations different moves deal double damage against Minimize:Gen 1: no moves.Gen 2: Stomp.Gen 3: Astonish, Extrasensory, Needle Arm, Stomp.Gen 4: Stomp.Gen 5: Steamroller, Stomp.Gen 6: Body Slam, Dragon Rush, Flying Press, Heat Crash, Phantom Force, Shadow Force, Steamroller, Stomp.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Minimize turns into Z-Minimize and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

After You.name: After You
description: After You forces the target to attack first in the next turn. It can be targeted at opponents or team-mates.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, After You turns into Z-After You and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Metronome.name: Metronome
description: Metronome uses a random move chosen from nearly all existing moves, even if the user cannot normally learn it.

The random move is chosen at the point Metronome is used, so priority moves like Mach Punch will not go first. Although Metronome technically targets the user, the move it turns into will use its usual target (whether the opponent(s), teammate(s) or self), or target a random adjacent opponent in double/triple battles.
Metronome will not select a Z-Move or any of the following moves:
After You
Assist
Baneful Bunker
Beak Blast
Belch
Bestow
Celebrate
Chatter
Copycat
Counter
Covet
Crafty Shield
Destiny Bond
Detect
Diamond Storm
Dragon Ascent
Endure
Feint
Fleur Cannon
Focus Punch
Follow Me
Freeze Shock
Helping Hand
Hold Hands
Hyperspace Fury
Hyperspace Hole
Ice Burn
Instruct
Kings Shield
Light Of Ruin
Mat Block
Me First
Metronome
Mimic
Mind Blown
Mirror Coat
Mirror Move
Nature Power
Origin Pulse
Photon Geyser
Plasma Fists
Precipice Blades
Protect
Quash
Quick Guard
Rage Powder
Relic Song
Secret Sword
Shell Trap
Sketch
Sleep Talk
Snarl
Snatch
Snore
Spectral Thief
Spiky Shield
Spotlight
Steam Eruption
Struggle
Switcheroo
Techno Blast
Thief
Thousand Arrows
Thousand Waves
Transform
Trick
V Create
Wide Guard
If the user is holding a Choice Band, Choice Specs or Choice Scarf, multi-turn moves such as Dig or Rollout will fail on the second turn.

When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Metronome turns into Z-Metronome and becomes the Z-Move for the move selected (for example Tectonic Rage if Earthquake was chosen), in addition to its usual effect as above.

Moonlight.name: Moonlight
description: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.
In Generations 2-5, Moonlight is a Normal-type move.
When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Moonlight turns into Z-Moonlight and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Gravity.name: Gravity
description: Prevents moves like Fly and Bounce and the Ability Levitate for 5 turns.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gravity turns into Z-Gravity and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Meteor Mash.name: Meteor Mash
description: Meteor Mash deals damage and has a 20% chance of raising the user's Attack by one stage.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
In Generations 3-5, Meteor Mash has 100 base power.
In Generations 3-5, Meteor Mash has 85% accuracy.
When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Meteor Mash turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 175.

Follow Me.name: Follow Me
description: In Double Battle, the user takes all the attacks.
In Generations 3-5, Follow Me has a priority of +3.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Follow Me turns into Z-Follow Me and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Cosmic Power.name: Cosmic Power
description: Cosmic Power raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Cosmic Power turns into Z-Cosmic Power and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Moonblast.name: Moonblast
description: Moonblast deals damage and has a 30% chance of lowering the target's Special Attack by one stage.
When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Moonblast turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 175.

Healing Wish.name: Healing Wish
description: The user faints and the next Pokémon released is fully healed.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Healing Wish has no additional effect.

Fairy Wind.name: Fairy Wind
description: Fairy Wind deals damage with no added effects.
When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fairy Wind turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 100.

Aromatherapy.name: Aromatherapy
description: Cures all status problems in your party.
When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aromatherapy turns into Z-Aromatherapy and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Covet.name: Covet
description: Covet deals damage and steals the target's held item, if the user is not already holding an item.

Items stolen from wild Pokémon are kept after the battle ends, but items stolen from a Trainer's Pokémon are not. Items stolen from the player's Pokémon, either by wild Pokémon or Trainer Pokémon, are returned at the end of the battle. All held items in wi-fi/linked battles (including Battle Tower/Subway/Maison) are returned to their respective owners at the end of a battle.
If the item would activate on attack (e.g. Focus Band), it does so before being stolen. If the item is consumable on attack (e.g. Focus Sash) then the item is consumed as normal and cannot be stolen.

Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon.
In Generations 3-4, Covet has 40 base power.
In Generations 3-5, Covet has 40 PP.
In Generations 3-4, Covet steals a Trainer Pokémon's item permanently, but a wild Pokémon or a Trainer's Pokémon using Covet will not steal the player's item at all.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Covet turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 120.

Fake Tears.name: Fake Tears
description: Fake Tears lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fake Tears turns into Z-Fake Tears and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Heal Pulse.name: Heal Pulse
description: Heal Pulse restores half of the target's maximum HP. It can be used on team-mates but not on itself.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heal Pulse turns into Z-Heal Pulse and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Mimic.name: Mimic
description: Mimic copies the last move used by the target (replacing Mimic). The copied move always has 5 PP. The effect only lasts while the user is in battle: if the user switches out or when the battle ends, the move becomes Mimic again.
Mimic cannot copy Chatter, Metronome, Sketch or Struggle.
The following Pokémon evolve after learning Mimic:
Mime Jr (evolves into Mr Mime) - learnt at level 15 from Pokémon Black/White 2 onwards (level 18 in earlier games).
Bonsly (evolves into Sudowoodo) - learnt at level 15 from Pokémon X/Y onwards (level 17 or 33 in earlier games).
In Generations 1-2, Mimic has 100% accuracy.
In Generation 1, Mimic allows the user to choose any of the opponent's moves to copy.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mimic turns into Z-Mimic and raises Accuracy one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Misty Terrain.name: Misty Terrain
description: Misty Terrain creates a low-lying mist lasting 5 turns, that protects all grounded Pokémon from status conditions (including confusion). It also halves the power of Dragon type moves while in effect.
Grounded Pokémon are simply those that are not raised. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary.
Misty Terrain is a terrain condition and can coexist at the same time as weather conditions, but not other terrain conditions.
The move Nature Power turns into Moonblast under Misty Terrain.
When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Misty Terrain turns into Z-Misty Terrain and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Dazzling Gleam.name: Dazzling Gleam
description: Dazzling Gleam deals damage and hits all adjacent opponents in double/triple battles.
When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dazzling Gleam turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 160.

Drain Punch.name: Drain Punch
description: Drain Punch deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained.

If the user is holding a Big Root, the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.
In Generation 4, Drain Punch has 60 base power.
In Generation 4, Drain Punch has 5 PP.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Drain Punch turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 140.

Recycle.name: Recycle
description: User's used hold item is restored.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Recycle turns into Z-Recycle and raises Speed two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Incinerate.name: Incinerate
description: Incinerate deals damage and if the target is holding a Berry, it is burnt and becomes no longer usable.
If Incinerate would be super-effective and the target is holding an Occa Berry, the Berry activates before the move hits so does not get burnt.
In Generation 5, Incinerate has 30 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Incinerate turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 120.

Confuse Ray.name: Confuse Ray
description: Confuse Ray causes the target to become confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack.
Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Confuse Ray turns into Z-Confuse Ray and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Extrasensory.name: Extrasensory
description: Extrasensory deals damage and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).
Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
In Generations 3-5, Extrasensory has 30 PP.
In Generation 3 if the target has used Minimize, Extrasensory deals double damage.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Extrasensory turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160.

Imprison.name: Imprison
description: Opponent is unable to use moves that the user also knows.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Imprison turns into Z-Imprison and raises Special Defense two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Grudge.name: Grudge
description: If the users faints after using this move, the PP for the opponent's last move is depleted.
When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Grudge turns into Z-Grudge and makes the Pokémon become the center of attention, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Flame Charge.name: Flame Charge
description: Flame Charge deals damage and raises the user's Speed by one stage.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flame Charge turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 100.

Howl.name: Howl
description: Howl raises the Attack of the user and its teammates by one stage.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
In Generations 3-7, Howl only raises the user's Attack.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Howl turns into Z-Howl and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Hypnosis.name: Hypnosis
description: Hypnosis puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns.
Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.
In Pokémon Diamond & Pearl, Hypnosis has 70% accuracy.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hypnosis turns into Z-Hypnosis and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Memento.name: Memento
description: User faints, sharply lowers opponent's Attack and Special Attack.
In Generation 3, Memento always hits.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Memento turns into Z-Memento and fully restores the HP of the Pokémon switching in, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Power Swap.name: Power Swap
description: User and opponent swap Attack and Special Attack.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power Swap turns into Z-Power Swap and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Ominous Wind.name: Ominous Wind
description: Ominous Wind deals damage and has a 10% chance of raising the user's Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed by one stage each.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ominous Wind turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 120.

Echoed Voice.name: Echoed Voice
description: Echoed Voice deals damage starting at base power 40, and increases by 40 each turn if used by any Pokémon on the field, up to a maximum base power of 200.
It does not reset if it misses, as long as the move is attempted each turn. The power does not increase during a turn (if multiple Pokémon use it), only after each turn.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Echoed Voice turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

Hyper Voice.name: Hyper Voice
description: Hyper Voice deals damage with no additional effect, besides targeting multiple foes.Hyper Voice has no effect on Pokémon with the ability Soundproof.
In Generation 3, Hyper Voice is categorized as Physical.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyper Voice turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 175.

Perish Song.name: Perish Song
description: Any Pokémon in play when this attack is used faints in 3 turns.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Perish Song turns into Z-Perish Song and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Misty Explosion.name: Misty Explosion
description: The user attacks everything around it and faints upon using this move. This move’s power is increased on Misty Terrain.
Misty Explosion is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.

Self-Destruct.name: Self-Destruct
description: Self-Destruct deals high damage, but causes the user to faint.
In Generation 1, Self-Destruct has 130 base power.
In Generations 1-5, this move's name is formatted as Selfdestruct.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Self-Destruct turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 200.

Bounce.name: Bounce
description: The user of Bounce will spring up on the first turn, disappearing from view and becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, Bounce deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target.

While in the air, the Pokémon can only be hit by the moves Gust, Twister, Thunder, Sky Uppercut and Smack Down, with Gust and Twister dealing twice normal damage. Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit for regular power.
Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Bounce executes in one turn.
When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bounce turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 160.

Retaliate.name: Retaliate
description: Inflicts double damage if a teammate fainted on the last turn.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Retaliate turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.

Ally Switch.name: Ally Switch
description: Ally Switch swaps the user with its teammate. In triple battles the user must be on either end, not in the middle.
In Generations 5-6, Ally Switch has a priority of +1.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ally Switch turns into Z-Ally Switch and raises Speed two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Expanding Force.name: Expanding Force
description: The user attacks the target with its psychic power. This move’s power goes up and damages all opposing Pokémon on Psychic Terrain.
Expanding Force is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.

Magic Room.name: Magic Room
description: Magic Room suppresses the effects of held items for all Pokémon for five turns.
In Generation 5, Magic Room has a priority of -7.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Magic Room turns into Z-Magic Room and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Absorb.name: Absorb
description: Absorb deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained.

If the user is holding a Big Root, the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.
In Pokémon Let's Go Pikachu & Let's Go Eevee, Absorb has 40 base power.
In Generations 1-3, Absorb has 20 PP.
In Pokémon Let's Go Pikachu & Let's Go Eevee, Absorb has 15 PP.
When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Absorb turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 100.

Mean Look.name: Mean Look
description: Opponent cannot flee or switch.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mean Look turns into Z-Mean Look and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Quick Guard.name: Quick Guard
description: Quick Guard protects the user's team from all increased priority moves (such as Extreme Speed or Bullet Punch), for the duration of the turn. It has priority +3 so will activate before most other moves.

The accuracy of Quick Guard does not decrease if used consecutively after itself or Wide Guard. However, it does decrease the accuracy of Protect, Detect, Endure, Spiky Shield, King's Shield and Baneful Bunker by 1⁄3 each time it or Wide Guard is used.
In Generation 5, the accuracy of Quick Guard decreases by 1⁄2 each time it is used consecutively after itself or any protecting move listed above.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Quick Guard turns into Z-Quick Guard and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Leech Life.name: Leech Life
description: Leech Life deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained.

If the user is holding a Big Root, the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.
In Generations 1-6, Leech Life has 20 base power.
In Generations 1-6, Leech Life has 15 PP.
When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leech Life turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 160.

Cross Poison.name: Cross Poison
description: Cross Poison deals damage and has a 10% chance of poisoning the target. It also has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24).
Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.
When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Cross Poison turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 140.

Strength Sap.name: Strength Sap
description: The user restores its HP by the same amount as the target's Attack stat. It also lowers the target's Attack stat. (100% chance)
When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Strength Sap turns into Z-Strength Sap and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Teeter Dance.name: Teeter Dance
description: Teeter Dance causes all adjacent Pokémon to become confused. In single battles this is simply the opponent; in double/triple battles it includes all adjacent opponents and teammate(s).

Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack.
Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Teeter Dance turns into Z-Teeter Dance and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Corrosive Gas.name: Corrosive Gas
description: The user surrounds everything around it with highly acidic gas and melts away items they hold.
Corrosive Gas is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.

Spore.name: Spore
description: Spore puts the target to sleep. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns.
Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.
When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spore turns into Z-Spore and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Wide Guard.name: Wide Guard
description: Wide Guard protects the user's team from all multi-target moves (such as Surf or Rock Slide), for the duration of the turn. It has priority +3 so will activate before most other moves.

The accuracy of Wide Guard does not decrease if used consecutively after itself or Quick Guard. However, it does decrease the accuracy of Protect, Detect, Endure, Spiky Shield, King's Shield and Baneful Bunker by 1⁄3 each time it or Quick Guard is used.
In Generation 5, the accuracy of Wide Guard decreases by 1⁄2 each time it is used consecutively after itself or any protecting move listed above.
When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wide Guard turns into Z-Wide Guard and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Struggle Bug.name: Struggle Bug
description: Struggle Bug deals damage and lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
In Generation 5, Struggle Bug has 30 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Struggle Bug turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 100.

Morning Sun.name: Morning Sun
description: User recovers HP. Amount varies with the weather.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Morning Sun turns into Z-Morning Sun and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Teleport.name: Teleport
description: In Pokémon Let's Go Pikachu/Eevee and Pokémon Sword/Shield, Teleport switches the user out.
From Pokémon Red & Blue to Pokémon Ultra Sun & Ultra Moon, Teleport has a priority of 0.

From Pokémon Red & Blue to Pokémon Ultra Sun & Ultra Moon, Teleport allows the user to flee a wild battle. It will always fail in a Trainer battle. It will fail in wild battles if the user would normally be unable to flee (due to a trapping move like Fire Spin or ability like Arena Trap).
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Teleport turns into Z-Teleport and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.

If you are outside, Teleport will instantly transport you back to the last Pokémon Center you visited. It does not work in caves or buildings. In Generation 4 it does not work in any town or city, only in routes.

Fissure.name: Fissure
description: If it hits, Fissure is guaranteed to make the opponent faint. Its accuracy increases if the user is a higher level than the target Pokémon, but fails if the target is higher level.
Its accuracy (as a percentage) is calculated as below, ignoring all other accuracy and evasion modifiers:
This means that if the user and target Pokémon are the same level, Fissure has 30% accuracy.
In Generation 1, Fissure has 30% accuracy.
In Generation 1, it can hit Pokémon of any level, but does not affect Pokémon with a higher Speed than the user.
When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fissure turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 180.

Metal Sound.name: Metal Sound
description: Metal Sound lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Metal Sound turns into Z-Metal Sound and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Foul Play.name: Foul Play
description: Foul Play uses the opponent's Attack stat instead of the user's in damage calculation. In other words, the move acts as if the target is attacking themselves, and thus is more powerful when the opponent has higher Attack.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Foul Play turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 175.

Parting Shot.name: Parting Shot
description: Parting Shot lowers the opponent's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each, then the user switches out of battle.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Parting Shot turns into Z-Parting Shot and fully restores the HP of the Pokémon switching in, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Lash Out.name: Lash Out
description: The user lashes out to vent its frustration toward the target. If its stats were lowered during the turn, the power of this move is doubled.
Lash Out is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.

Power Gem.name: Power Gem
description: Power Gem deals damage with no additional effect.
In Generations 4-5, Power Gem has 70 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power Gem turns into Continental Crush and has base power 160.

Quash.name: Quash
description: Quash forces the target Pokémon to move last in the current turn.
It does not have priority so will fail if the target already moved in the current turn. Therefore it is useless in single battles and only works in double/triple battles.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Quash turns into Z-Quash and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Skitter Smack.name: Skitter Smack
description: The user skitters behind the target to attack. This also lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
Skitter Smack is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.

Burning Jealousy.name: Burning Jealousy
description: Hits all opponents, and burns any that have had their stats boosted.

Soak.name: Soak
description: Soak changes the target's type to Water. It does not work on Pokémon with the ability Multitype.
When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Soak turns into Z-Soak and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Wonder Room.name: Wonder Room
description: Wonder Room switches the Defense and Special Defense of all Pokémon in battle, for 5 turns.
In Generation 5, Wonder Room has a priority of -7.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wonder Room turns into Z-Wonder Room and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Bubble.name: Bubble
description: Bubble deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Speed by one stage.
In Generations 1-5, Bubble has 20 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bubble turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 100.

Clear Smog.name: Clear Smog
description: Removes all of the target's stat changes.
When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Clear Smog turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 100.

Cross Chop.name: Cross Chop
description: Cross Chop deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24).
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Cross Chop turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 180.

Future Sight.name: Future Sight
description: Future Sight deals damage, but does not hit until two turns after the move is used. If the opponent switched Pokémon in the meantime, the new Pokémon gets hit, with their type and stats taken into account.
Future Sight cannot be stopped by Protect, Detect, Endure or the Wonder Guard ability.
In Generations 2-4, Future Sight has 80 base power.
In Generation 5, Future Sight has 100 base power.
In Generations 2-4, Future Sight has 90% accuracy.
In Generations 2-4, Future Sight has 15 PP.

In Generations 2-4, the damage Future Sight deals is typeless, which means it could hit Dark-type Pokémon. It also uses the Special Defense stat of the originally targeted Pokémon, even if said Pokémon switched out in the meantime.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Future Sight turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 190.

Simple Beam.name: Simple Beam
description: Simple Beam changes the target's ability to Simple.
It does not cancel any ability's effects already felt (such as the Attack drop from Intimidate), but it does stop any further effects the ability may have (for example, damage from Rough Skin).
It does not work on Pokémon with the abilities Truant or Multitype.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Simple Beam turns into Z-Simple Beam and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Low Sweep.name: Low Sweep
description: Low Sweep deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
In Generation 5, Low Sweep has 60 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Low Sweep turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120.

Low Kick.name: Low Kick
description: Low Kick inflicts greater damage on heavier opponents, as shown in the table.
Low Kick is able to hit opponents hidden underwater from using Dive.
For reference, the following Pokémon take 120 base damage from Low Kick. From Generation 5 onwards, heavy Pokémon kick up dust as they land switching in.

#076 Alolan Golem

#103 Alolan Exeggutor
#130 Gyarados (and Mega)

#143 Snorlax
#149 Dragonite

#208 Mega Steelix

#248 Tyranitar (and Mega)
#249 Lugia

#323 Camerupt (and Mega)
#362 Glalie (and Mega)

#376 Metagross (and Mega)
#377 Regirock
#379 Registeel

#383 Groudon (and Primal)
#384 Rayquaza (and Mega)

#450 Hippowdon

#718 Zygarde (Complete Forme)
#720 Hoopa (Hoopa Unbound)

#776 Turtonator

#790 Cosmoem
#791 Solgaleo
#794 Buzzwole
#797 Celesteela
#799 Guzzlord
#800 Necrozma (all Formes)
#805 Stakataka
In Generations 1-2, Low Kick has 50 base power.
In Generations 1-2, Low Kick has 90% accuracy.
In Generations 1-2, it has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Low Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 160.

Seismic Toss.name: Seismic Toss
