description: The damage of Seismic Toss is equal to the user's level. So at level 100 the Pokémon will inflict 100 HP damage.
In Generation 1 Seismic Toss can hit Ghost-type Pokémon despite their immunity to Fighting-type attacks.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Seismic Toss turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.

Close Combat.name: Close Combat
description: Close Combat deals damage but lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each after attacking.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Close Combat turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 190.

Karate Chop.name: Karate Chop
description: Karate Chop deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24).
In Generation 1, Karate Chop is a Normal-type move.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Karate Chop turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.

Bulk Up.name: Bulk Up
description: Bulk Up raises the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bulk Up turns into Z-Bulk Up and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Burn Up.name: Burn Up
description: To inflict massive damage, the user burns itself out. After using this move, the user will no longer be Fire type.
When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Burn Up turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 195.

Snarl.name: Snarl
description: Snarl deals damage and lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Snarl turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 100.

Extreme Speed.name: Extreme Speed
description: Extreme Speed deals damage and attacks before the majority of other moves (priority of +2).
In Generations 2-4, Extreme Speed has a priority of +1.
In Generations 2-5, this move's name is formatted as ExtremeSpeed.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Extreme Speed turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.

Raging Fury.name: Raging Fury
description: The user rampages and spews vicious flames to inflict damage on the target, then becomes fixated on using this move.

Bubble Beam.name: Bubble Beam
description: Bubble Beam deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Speed by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
In Generations 1-5, this move's name is formatted as BubbleBeam.
When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bubble Beam turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 120.

Mind Reader.name: Mind Reader
description: User's next attack is guaranteed to hit.
In Generations 2-3, Mind Reader has 100% accuracy.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mind Reader turns into Z-Mind Reader and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Circle Throw.name: Circle Throw
description: In battles, the opponent switches. In the wild, the Pokémon runs.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Circle Throw turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120.

Dynamic Punch.name: Dynamic Punch
description: Dynamic Punch deals damage and confuses the target, if it hits. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack.
Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
In Generations 2-5, this move's name is formatted as DynamicPunch.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dynamic Punch turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 180.

Submission.name: Submission
description: Submission deals damage, but the user receives 1⁄4 of the damage it inflicts in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 25 HP.
In Generations 1-6, Submission has 25 PP.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Submission turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 160.

Coaching.name: Coaching
description: The user properly coaches its ally Pokémon, boosting their Attack and Defense stats.
Coaching is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.

Darkest Lariat.name: Darkest Lariat
description: Darkest Lariat deals damage, but ignores changes to the target's stats (i.e. Defense and Evasion in this case).
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Darkest Lariat turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160.
When Incineroar is holding Incinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Darkest Lariat turns into Malicious Moonsault and has base power 180.

Guard Split.name: Guard Split
description: Guard Split averages the user's Defense and Special Defense with those of the target. Stat boosts are not taken into account.

For example, if the user's Defense was 100, the opponent's was 200, and the opponent had used Screech on the user, then both Pokémon would end up with 150 Defense. Due to the stat drop, the Guard Split user's effective Defense would now be 75 (instead of the 50 it was originally).
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Guard Split turns into Z-Guard Split and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Guard Swap.name: Guard Swap
description: User and opponent swap Defense and Special Defense.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Guard Swap turns into Z-Guard Swap and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Knock Off.name: Knock Off
description: Knock Off deals damage and if the target has a held item, damage is increased by 50% (i.e. 97.5 base power) and the item is removed for the remainder of the battle (switching out does not restore the item). All items are restored at the end of a battle.
If the item would activate on attack (e.g. Focus Band), it does so before being stolen. If the item is consumable on attack (e.g. Focus Sash) then the item is consumed as normal and cannot be stolen.

Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon. Note that in these cases the damage dealt does not increase.
In Generation 3, Knock Off is categorized as Special.
In Generations 3-5, Knock Off has 20 base power.
In Generations 3-5, Knock Off does not increase damage when knocking off items.
In Generation 3, Knock Off is a Special move due to the type-based categorization of moves.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Knock Off turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 120.

Magic Coat.name: Magic Coat
description: Magic Coat reflects any move causing status conditions - for example Thunder Wave or Toxic - back to the attacker. It applies only to the turn it is used.
In Generations 3-4, Teeter Dance and Memento are not affected by Magic Coat.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Magic Coat turns into Z-Magic Coat and raises Special Defense two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Power Trick.name: Power Trick
description: User's own Attack and Defense switch.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power Trick turns into Z-Power Trick and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Psycho Shift.name: Psycho Shift
description: Psycho Shift transfers any major status condition the user has (Poison, Burn, Paralysis, Sleep, Freeze) to the target, if the target does not already have a status condition.

Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep. Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen.
In Generations 4-5, Psycho Shift has 90% accuracy.
In Generation 4, if Psycho Shift is used against a Pokémon with Synchronize the user will regain the status condition at the end of the turn.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psycho Shift turns into Z-Psycho Shift and raises Special Attack two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Trick Room.name: Trick Room
description: Slower Pokémon move first in the turn for 5 turns.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Trick Room turns into Z-Trick Room and raises Accuracy one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Kinesis.name: Kinesis
description: Kinesis lowers the target's Accuracy by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Kinesis turns into Z-Kinesis and raises Evasiveness one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Psycho Cut.name: Psycho Cut
description: Psycho Cut deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24).
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psycho Cut turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 140.

Recover.name: Recover
description: Recover restores up to 50% of the user's maximum HP.
In Generations 1-3, Recover has 20 PP.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Recover turns into Z-Recover and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Psyshock.name: Psyshock
description: Inflicts damage based on the target's Defense, not Special Defense.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psyshock turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160.

Role Play.name: Role Play
description: Role Play copies the opponent's ability, replacing its own with that of the target's.
Role Play does not work on Pokémon with Wonder Guard or Multitype.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Role Play turns into Z-Role Play and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Vital Throw.name: Vital Throw
description: Vital Throw deals damage with lower priority, so most attacks will take place before it. Vital Throw ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Vital Throw turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 140.

Dual Chop.name: Dual Chop
description: Dual Chop deals damage and will strike twice (with 40 base power each time).
Each strike of Dual Chop is treated like a separate attack:
Each strike can get a critical hit independently.
Abilities that activate on contact (Static, Weak Armor, Iron Barbs etc.) activate for each strike.
If the Sturdy ability, Focus Sash, or Focus Band activates before the final hit, the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the opponent to faint.
If the first hit breaks a Substitute, the second hit will deal damage to the target Pokémon.
The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.
When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dual Chop turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 100.

Bullet Punch.name: Bullet Punch
description: Bullet Punch deals damage and has a priority of +1.
Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.
When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bullet Punch turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 100.

Double Hit.name: Double Hit
description: Double Hit deals damage and will strike twice (with 35 base power each time).
Each strike of Double Hit is treated like a separate attack:
Each strike can get a critical hit independently.
Abilities that activate on contact (Static, Weak Armor, Iron Barbs etc.) activate for each strike.
If the Sturdy ability, Focus Sash, or Focus Band activates before the final hit, the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the opponent to faint.
If the first hit breaks a Substitute, the second hit will deal damage to the target Pokémon.
The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.
Aipom evolves into Ambipom after learning Double Hit - learnt at level 32.
In Generation 4, if a Focus Sash or Focus Band activates before the final hit, subsequent hits do not cause the holder to faint.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Double Hit turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.

Mach Punch.name: Mach Punch
description: Mach Punch deals damage and has a priority of +1.
Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mach Punch turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.

Heavy Slam.name: Heavy Slam
description: Heavy Slam inflicts more damage the heavier the user compared to the opponent. The table shows the different base powers for each ratio, where r = UserWeight ÷ TargetWeight
For example, if the user's weight is at least 4 times more than the target but less than 5 times, Heavy Slam hits with 100 base power.
If the target has used Minimize, Heavy Slam ignores accuracy and deals double damage.
In Generations 5-6, the Minimize effect did not occur.
When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heavy Slam turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 160.

Leaf Tornado.name: Leaf Tornado
description: Leaf Tornado deals damage and has a 30% chance of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leaf Tornado turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 120.

Leaf Blade.name: Leaf Blade
description: Leaf Blade deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24).
In Generation 3, Leaf Blade is categorized as Special.
In Generation 3, Leaf Blade has 70 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leaf Blade turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 175.

Acid Armor.name: Acid Armor
description: Acid Armor raises the user's Defense by two stages.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
In Generations 1-5, Acid Armor has 40 PP.
When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Acid Armor turns into Z-Acid Armor and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Acupressure.name: Acupressure
description: Acupressure raises a random stat - Attack, Defense, Speed, Special Attack, Special Defense, Accuracy or Evasion - by two stages. It will always choose a stat that is not already maximized.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Acupressure is unlike other status moves in that it can be targeted at itself or an adjacent teammate. It cannot be used on an ally if they are behind a Substitute, but the user can apply Acupressure to itself if behind a Substitute.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Acupressure turns into Z-Acupressure and raises critical-hit ratio one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Aurora Beam.name: Aurora Beam
description: Aurora Beam deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Attack by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aurora Beam turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 120.

Reflect Type.name: Reflect Type
description: Reflect Type changes the user's type to match the type(s) of the target.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Reflect Type turns into Z-Reflect Type and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Rock Polish.name: Rock Polish
description: Rock Polish raises the user's Speed by two stages.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Polish turns into Z-Rock Polish and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Rock Throw.name: Rock Throw
description: Rock Throw deals damage with no additional effect.
In Generation 1, Rock Throw has 65% accuracy.
When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Throw turns into Continental Crush and has base power 100.

Smack Down.name: Smack Down
description: Smack Down deals damage and knocks the target to the ground. Any raised Pokémon now become susceptible to Ground moves and Arena Trap. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary.

Smack Down can hit Pokémon using Fly or Bounce and will bring them back down to the ground, thus cancelling the moves. It can also hit Pokémon using Sky Drop but does not knock them to the ground. It does not knock down Substitutes but deals damage to the Substitute as normal.
When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Smack Down turns into Continental Crush and has base power 100.

Explosion.name: Explosion
description: Explosion deals high damage, but causes the user to faint.
In Generation 1, Explosion has 170 base power.
In Generations 1-4, the opponent's defense stat is temporarily halved when calculating the damage. This gives Explosion an effective power of 500 (or 340 in Gen 1).
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Explosion turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 200.

Autotomize.name: Autotomize
description: Autotomize raises the user's Speed by two stages and reduces its weight by 100kg (to a minimum of 0.1kg). Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Decreasing weight affects these moves:
Grass Knot (lower damage when receiving)
Heat Crash (lower damage when attacking, higher damage when receiving)
Heavy Slam (lower damage when attacking, higher damage when receiving)
Low Kick (lower damage when receiving)
The effect of the weight change cannot be Baton-Passed (but the Speed change is passed as normal).
When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Autotomize turns into Z-Autotomize and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Block.name: Block
description: Opponent cannot flee or switch.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Block turns into Z-Block and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Hammer Arm.name: Hammer Arm
description: Hammer Arm deals damage but lowers the user's Speed by one stage after attacking.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hammer Arm turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 180.

Stomp.name: Stomp
description: Stomp deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).
Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
If the target has used Minimize, Stomp ignores accuracy and deals double damage.
Steenee evolves into Tsareena after learning Stomp - learnt at level 29.
In Generation 1 the Minimize effect did not occur. In Generations 2-5 accuracy is not bypassed against a Minimize user.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Stomp turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 120.

Slack Off.name: Slack Off
description: Slack Off recovers up to 50% of the user's maximum HP.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Slack Off turns into Z-Slack Off and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Psychic Terrain.name: Psychic Terrain
description: Psychic Terrain creates a low-lying psychic field lasting 5 turns, that prevents grounded Pokémon from being hit by high-priority moves (such as Quick Attack or Sucker Punch). The power of Psychic type moves also increases while in effect.
Grounded Pokémon are simply those that are not raised. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary.
Psychic Terrain is a terrain condition and can coexist at the same time as weather conditions, but not other terrain conditions.
The move Nature Power turns into Psychic under Psychic Terrain.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psychic Terrain turns into Z-Psychic Terrain and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Shell Side Arm.name: Shell Side Arm
description: May poison opponent. Inflicts either Special or Physical damage, whichever is better.

Magnet Rise.name: Magnet Rise
description: User becomes immune to Ground-type moves for 5 turns.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Magnet Rise turns into Z-Magnet Rise and raises Evasiveness one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Lock-On.name: Lock-On
description: User's next attack is guaranteed to hit.
In Generations 2-3, Lock-On has 100% accuracy.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Lock-On turns into Z-Lock-On and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Zap Cannon.name: Zap Cannon
description: Zap Cannon deals damage and paralyzes the target, if it hits. Paralyzed Pokémon have a 25% chance of not being able to attack, and their Speed is decreased by 50% (75% in Generations 1-6).
Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
In Generations 2-3, Zap Cannon has 100 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Zap Cannon turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 190.

Steel Beam.name: Steel Beam
description: Steel Beam deals damage but the user loses 50% of its HP.

Detect.name: Detect
description: Detect prevents any attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. The move functions identically to Protect.
The accuracy of Detect drops by 1⁄3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect, Endure, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, King's Shield, or Baneful Bunker.
Damage-dealing Z-Moves bypass Detect but deal 1⁄4 of the damage.
In Generation 2, Detect has a priority of +2.
In Generations 3-4, Detect has a priority of +3.

In Generations 2-5, the accuracy of Detect decreases by 1⁄2 each time it is used consecutively after itself or any protecting move listed above. In Generation 4 only, it has a minimum accuracy of 1⁄8 (i.e. from the fourth consecutive use onwards).
In Diamond and Pearl only, Thunder during rain and Blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to bypass Detect.
In Generation 2, Detect will fail if the user is behind a Substitute.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Detect turns into Z-Detect and raises Evasiveness one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

First Impression.name: First Impression
description: Although this move has great power, it only works the first turn the user is in battle.
When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, First Impression turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 175.

Lunge.name: Lunge
description: The user makes a lunge at the target, attacking with full force. This also lowers the target's Attack stat. (100% chance)
When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Lunge turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 160.

Jump Kick.name: Jump Kick
description: Jump Kick deals damage, however, if it misses the user keeps going and crashes, losing 1⁄2 of its maximum HP. Jump Kick cannot be used if Gravity is in effect.
In Generations 1-3, Jump Kick has 70 base power.
In Generation 4, Jump Kick has 85 base power.
In Generations 1-4, Jump Kick has 25 PP.
In Generation 1, the crash damage is always 1 HP. In Generation 2, the crash damage is 1⁄8 of the damage the attack would have inflicted, while in Generations 3-4 it is 1⁄2 of that potential damage.

In Generations 2-3, the user does not crash if Jump Kick is used against a Ghost-type Pokémon. In Generation 4 it does crash, but since it would not deal damage the user takes damage equal to half of the target's maximum HP.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Jump Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 180.

Ice Shard.name: Ice Shard
description: Ice Shard deals damage and has a priority of +1.
Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.
When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Shard turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 100.

Entrainment.name: Entrainment
description: Entrainment makes the target's ability the same as the user's.
It does not work on Pokémon with the abilities Truant, Multitype or Zen Mode.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Entrainment turns into Z-Entrainment and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Lick.name: Lick
description: Lick deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target.
Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
In Generations 1-5, Lick has 20 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Lick turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 100.

Sheer Cold.name: Sheer Cold
description: If it hits, Sheer Cold is guaranteed to make the opponent faint. Its accuracy increases if the user is a higher level than the target Pokémon, but fails if the target is higher level or is Ice type.
Its accuracy (as a percentage) is calculated as below, if the user is Ice type, ignoring all other accuracy and evasion modifiers:
This means that if the user and target Pokémon are the same level, Sheer Cold has 30% accuracy. If the user is not Ice type, its accuracy percentage is:
In Generations 3-6, Ice type Pokémon are not immune to Sheer Cold. Non-Ice type users keep the 30% base accuracy.
When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sheer Cold turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 180.

Poison Gas.name: Poison Gas
description: Poison Gas causes the target to become poisoned. Poisoned Pokémon lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP each turn.
Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.
In Generations 1-4, Poison Gas has 55% accuracy.
In Generation 5, Poison Gas has 80% accuracy.
In Generations 1-4, the move only targets a single opponent.
When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Poison Gas turns into Z-Poison Gas and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Smog.name: Smog
description: Smog deals damage and has a 40% chance of poisoning the target.
Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.
In Generations 1-3, Smog is categorized as Physical.
In Generations 1-5, Smog has 20 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Smog turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 100.

Power-Up Punch.name: Power-Up Punch
description: Power-Up Punch deals damage and raises the user's Attack by one stage.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power-Up Punch turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.

Shadow Punch.name: Shadow Punch
description: Shadow Punch deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.
When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shadow Punch turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 120.

Shadow Sneak.name: Shadow Sneak
description: Shadow Sneak deals damage and has a priority of +1.
Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.
When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shadow Sneak turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 100.

Razor Shell.name: Razor Shell
description: Razor Shell deals damage and has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Defense by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Razor Shell turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 140.

Spikes.name: Spikes
description: Spikes lays a trap of thorns around the foe, which hurts Pokémon switching in to the opposing field. It can be used up to three times to inflict more damage on incoming Pokémon, equal to a fraction of the Pokémon's HP as shown in the table.
The move will not cause damage to any raised Pokémon. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary.
Spikes can be cleared from the field by the moves Rapid Spin (around the user) or Defog (around the target).
When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spikes turns into Z-Spikes and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Night Shade.name: Night Shade
description: The damage of Night Shade is equal to the user's level. So at level 100 the Pokémon will inflict 100 HP damage.
In Generations 1-3, Night Shade is categorized as Physical.
In Generation 1, Night Shade also hits Normal- and Psychic-type Pokémon despite their immunity to Ghost-type attacks.
When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Night Shade turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 100.

Destiny Bond.name: Destiny Bond
description: If the user faints, the opponent also faints.
When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Destiny Bond turns into Z-Destiny Bond and makes the Pokémon become the center of attention, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Power Shift.name: Power Shift
description: Power Shift switches the user's Attack stat with its Defense, and its Special Attack with Special Defense.

Bind.name: Bind
description: Bind inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns.
If the user holds a Grip Claw, the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1⁄6 of the target's maximum HP.
In Generations 1-4, Bind has 75% accuracy.
In Generations 1-4, Bind's after-effects last for 2-5 turns instead of 4-5; holding Grip Claw they last for 5 turns.
In Generations 2-5, the target loses only 1⁄16 of their maximum HP after each turn, or 1⁄8 if a Binding Band is held.
In Generation 1, Bind inflicts regular damage for 2-5 turns. While in effect, the target is unable to attack.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bind turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

Meditate.name: Meditate
description: Meditate raises the user's Attack by one stage.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Meditate turns into Z-Meditate and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Power Split.name: Power Split
description: Power Split averages the user's Attack and Special Attack with those of the target. Stat boosts are not taken into account. The effect lasts until the battle ends or the Pokémon switches out.

For example, if the user's Attack was 100, the opponent's was 200, and the opponent had used Swords Dance, then both Pokémon would end up with 150 Attack. Due to the stat boost, the opponent's effective Attack would now be 300 (instead of the 400 it was originally).
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power Split turns into Z-Power Split and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Barrier.name: Barrier
description: Barrier raises the user's Defense by two stages.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
In Generations 1-5, Barrier has 30 PP.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Barrier turns into Z-Barrier and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Crabhammer.name: Crabhammer
description: Crabhammer deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24).
In Generations 1-3, Crabhammer is categorized as Special.
In Generations 1-5, Crabhammer has 90 base power.
In Generations 1-4, Crabhammer has 85% accuracy.
When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Crabhammer turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 180.

Guillotine.name: Guillotine
description: If it hits, Guillotine is guaranteed to make the opponent faint. Its accuracy increases if the user is a higher level than the target Pokémon, but fails if the target is higher level.
Its accuracy (as a percentage) is calculated as below, ignoring all other accuracy and evasion modifiers:
This means that if the user and target Pokémon are the same level, Guillotine has 30% accuracy.
In Generation 1, Guillotine has 30% accuracy.
In Generation 1, the move can hit Pokémon of any level, but does not affect Pokémon with a higher Speed than the user.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Guillotine turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 180.

Eerie Impulse.name: Eerie Impulse
description: Eerie Impulse lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Eerie Impulse turns into Z-Eerie Impulse and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Ice Ball.name: Ice Ball
description: Ice Ball deals damage for 5 turns, doubling in power each turn. The move stops if it misses on any turn. If it doesn't miss, Ice Ball will deal 30, 60, 120, 240 and 480 base power damage each turn respectively.
If the user has used Defense Curl in any previous turn (without switching out) then Ice Ball doubles in power, i.e. it will deal 60, 120, 240, 480 and 960 base power damage respectively.

As Ice Ball has 90% accuracy, the chances of it being successful for each turn (with normal Accuracy/Evasion and no other interruptions) are 90%, 81%, 73%, 66% and 59% respectively. In other words, roughly 3 out of every 5 times Ice Ball is used, it will hit for the full 5 turns.
In Generation 3, Ice Ball is categorized as Special.
When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Ball turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 100.

Magnetic Flux.name: Magnetic Flux
description: Magnetic Flux raises the Defense and Special Defense of any Pokémon on the user's team that has the Plus or Minus ability.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Magnetic Flux turns into Z-Magnetic Flux and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Chloroblast.name: Chloroblast
description: The user launches its amassed chlorophyll to inflict damage on the target. This also damages the user and lowers the user’s action speed.

Wood Hammer.name: Wood Hammer
description: Wood Hammer deals damage, but the user receives 1⁄3 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 90 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 30 HP.
When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wood Hammer turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 190.

Dragon Hammer.name: Dragon Hammer
description: The user uses its body like a hammer to attack the target and inflict damage.
When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Hammer turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 175.

Bone Rush.name: Bone Rush
description: Bone Rush hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.
Each strike of Bone Rush is treated like a separate attack:
Each strike can get a critical hit independently.
Abilities that activate on contact (Static, Weak Armor, Iron Barbs etc.) activate for each strike.
If the Sturdy ability, Focus Sash, or Focus Band activates before the final hit, the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the opponent to faint.
If the first hit breaks a Substitute, the second hit will deal damage to the target Pokémon.
The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.
The Skill Link ability will cause Bone Rush to always hit the maximum number of times.
In Generations 2-4, Bone Rush has 80% accuracy.
In Generations 2-4, if a Focus Sash or Focus Band activates before the final hit, subsequent hits do not cause the holder to faint.
In Generations 2-3, Bone Rush ends immediately if any hit breaks a Substitute.
When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bone Rush turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 140.

Bonemerang.name: Bonemerang
description: Bonemerang deals damage and will strike twice (with 50 base power each time).
Each strike of Bonemerang is treated like a separate attack:
Each strike can get a critical hit independently.
Abilities that activate on contact (Static, Weak Armor, Iron Barbs etc.) activate for each strike.
If the Sturdy ability, Focus Sash, or Focus Band activates before the final hit, the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the opponent to faint.
If the first hit breaks a Substitute, the second hit will deal damage to the target Pokémon.
The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.
In Generations 2-4, if a Focus Sash or Focus Band activates before the final hit, subsequent hits do not cause the holder to faint.
In Generations 1-3, Bonemerang ends immediately if any hit breaks a Substitute.
In Generation 1, each hit will always deal the same damage - if the first critical hits, so will the rest.
When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bonemerang turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 100.

Shadow Bone.name: Shadow Bone
description: May lower opponent's Defense. (20% chance)
When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shadow Bone turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 160.

Poltergeist.name: Poltergeist
description: The user attacks the target by controlling the target’s item. The move fails if the target doesn’t have an item.
Poltergeist is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.

High Jump Kick.name: High Jump Kick
description: High Jump Kick deals damage, however, if it misses the user keeps going and crashes, losing 1⁄2 of its maximum HP. High Jump Kick cannot be used if Gravity is in effect.
In Generations 1-3, High Jump Kick has 85 base power.
In Generation 4, High Jump Kick has 100 base power.
In Generations 1-4, High Jump Kick has 20 PP.
In Generations 1-5, this move's name is formatted as Hi Jump Kick.
In Generation 1, the crash damage is always 1 HP. In Generation 2, the crash damage is 1⁄8 of the damage the attack would have inflicted, while in Generations 3-4 it is 1⁄2 of that potential damage.

In Generations 2-3, the user does not crash if High Jump Kick is used against a Ghost-type Pokémon. In Generation 4 it does crash, but since it would not deal damage the user takes damage equal to half of the target's maximum HP.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, High Jump Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 195.

Vacuum Wave.name: Vacuum Wave
description: Vacuum Wave deals damage and has a priority of +1.
Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Vacuum Wave turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.

Pain Split.name: Pain Split
description: The user's and opponent's HP becomes the average of both.
In Generations 1-2, Pain Split has 100% accuracy.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Pain Split turns into Z-Pain Split and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Aromatic Mist.name: Aromatic Mist
description: Aromatic Mist raises the Special Defense of a teammate by one stage.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aromatic Mist turns into Z-Aromatic Mist and raises Special Defense two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Strange Steam.name: Strange Steam
description: May confuse opponent. (20% chance)

Soft-Boiled.name: Soft-Boiled
description: Soft-Boiled recovers up to 50% of the user's maximum HP.
In Generations 1-5, this move's name is formatted as Softboiled.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Soft-Boiled turns into Z-Soft-Boiled and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
In the field, using Soft-Boiled will take away 20% of the user's maximum HP and give it to another Pokémon. (It is unusable if the user's HP is below 20%.)

Heal Bell.name: Heal Bell
description: Heals the user's party's status conditions.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heal Bell turns into Z-Heal Bell and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Octazooka.name: Octazooka
description: Octazooka deals damage and has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Octazooka turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 120.

Meteor Beam.name: Meteor Beam
description: In this two-turn attack, the user gathers space power and boosts its Sp. Atk stat, then attacks the target on the next turn.
Meteor Beam is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.

Trick.name: Trick
description: Trick switches held items with the target. It does not require both Pokémon to be holding an item, in which case the item is simply given to the target or received from it.

Switching items with wild Pokémon is permanent (received items are kept, given items are lost). All held items in Trainer battles and wi-fi/linked battles (including Battle Tower/Subway/Maison) are returned to their respective owners at the end of a battle.

Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon.
In Generations 3-4, switching items with a Trainer's Pokémon is also permanent, but Trick will fail if used by a wild Pokémon or a Trainer's Pokémon.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Trick turns into Z-Trick and raises Speed two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Silver Wind.name: Silver Wind
description: Silver Wind deals damage and has a 10% chance of raising the user's Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed by one stage each.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
In Generation 3, Silver Wind is categorized as Physical.
When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Silver Wind turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 120.

Lovely Kiss.name: Lovely Kiss
description: Lovely Kiss puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns.
Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Lovely Kiss turns into Z-Lovely Kiss and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Lava Plume.name: Lava Plume
description: Lava Plume deals damage and has a 30% chance of burning the target.
Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.
When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Lava Plume turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 160.

Vise Grip.name: Vise Grip
description: Vise Grip deals damage with no additional effect.
In Generations 1-5, this move's name is formatted as ViceGrip.
In Generations 6-7, this move's name is formatted as Vice Grip.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Vise Grip turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

Storm Throw.name: Storm Throw
description: Storm Throw deals damage and always results in a critical hit, increasing its power to 90.
However, Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor, or those under the effect of Lucky Chant are immune to critical hits so Storm Throw will hit them with base power 60.
In Generation 5, Storm Throw has 40 base power.
In Generation 5, critical hits increase power by 2× rather than 1.5× so the effective power of Storm Throw is 80 with the critical hit.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Storm Throw turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120.

Freeze-Dry.name: Freeze-Dry
description: Freeze-Dry deals damage and has a 10% change of freezing the target. In addition to Ice's usual type advantages, Freeze-Dry is also super-effective against the Water type. This in effect gives the move its own (slightly different) type chart, as shown below:
When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Freeze-Dry turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 140.

Sparkling Aria.name: Sparkling Aria
description: Sparkling Aria deals damage, and if the target is burned, heals it.
When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sparkling Aria turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 175.
When Primarina is holding Primarium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sparkling Aria turns into Oceanic Operetta and has base power 195.

Transform.name: Transform
description: User takes on the form and attacks of the opponent.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Transform turns into Z-Transform and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Conversion.name: Conversion
description: Conversion changes the user's type to the same type as the first move in the Pokémon's move list.
For example, if the Pokémon has the moves Psybeam, Discharge, Recover and Conversion in that order, Conversion will change the user's type to Psychic.
In Generation 1, Conversion changes the user's type to the target Pokémon's type.
In Generations 2-4, Conversion changes the user's type to the type of any one of its moves randomly. It also cannot be used on Curse as it is the ??? type.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Conversion turns into Z-Conversion and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Conversion 2.name: Conversion 2
description: Conversion 2 changes the user's type to one that is resistant (or immune) to the last move used by the target, randomly.
For example, if the target last used a Fighting type move, Conversion 2 would change the user's type to one of Poison, Flying, Psychic, Bug, Ghost or Fairy at random.
In Generations 2-4, Conversion 2 only takes into account damaging moves that hit the user (from any Pokémon).
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Conversion 2 turns into Z-Conversion 2 and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Psychic Fangs.name: Psychic Fangs
description: The user bites the target with its psychic capabilities. This can also destroy Light Screen and Reflect.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psychic Fangs turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160.

Freezing Glare.name: Freezing Glare
description: May freeze opponent. (10% chance)

Thunderous Kick.name: Thunderous Kick
description: Lowers opponent's Defense. (100% chance)

Rising Voltage.name: Rising Voltage
description: The user attacks with electric voltage rising from the ground. This move’s power doubles when the target is on Electric Terrain.
Rising Voltage is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.

Fiery Wrath.name: Fiery Wrath
description: May cause flinching. (20% chance)

Draco Meteor.name: Draco Meteor
description: Draco Meteor deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
In Generations 4-5, Draco Meteor has 140 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Draco Meteor turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 195.

Psystrike.name: Psystrike
description: Inflicts damage based on the target's Defense, not Special Defense.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psystrike turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 180.

Speed Swap.name: Speed Swap
description: The user exchanges Speed stats with the target.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Speed Swap turns into Z-Speed Swap and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Solar Blade.name: Solar Blade
description: The user of Solar Blade will absorb light on the first turn. On the second turn, Solar Blade deals damage.
During intense sunlight or when holding a Power Herb, Solar Blade executes in one turn. During rain, hail or a sandstorm its power decreases by 50%.
When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Solar Blade turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 190.

Tail Slap.name: Tail Slap
description: Tail Slap hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.
Each strike of Tail Slap is treated like a separate attack:
Each strike can get a critical hit independently.
Abilities that activate on contact (Static, Weak Armor, Iron Barbs etc.) activate for each strike.
If the Sturdy ability, Focus Sash, or Focus Band activates before the final hit, the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the opponent to faint.
If the first hit breaks a Substitute, the second hit will deal damage to the target Pokémon.
The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.
The Skill Link ability will cause Tail Slap to always hit the maximum number of times.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tail Slap turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.

Phantom Force.name: Phantom Force
description: Phantom Force causes the user to disappear on the first turn, becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, it deals damage and can hit Pokémon using Protect or Detect.
In Generation 6 if the target has used Minimize, Phantom Force deals double damage and ignores accuracy.
When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Phantom Force turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 175.

Natural Gift.name: Natural Gift
description: Natural Gift deals damage with no additional effects. However, its type and base power vary depending on the user's held Berry. The grid below shows which Berries provide which power and type.
For example, if a Pokémon holding a Cheri Berry uses Natural Gift, it will become a base power 60, Fire-type attack; holding a Starf Berry it will become an 80 power Psychic-type move.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Natural Gift turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.

Grass Whistle.name: Grass Whistle
description: Grass Whistle puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns.
Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.
In Generations 3-5, this move's name is formatted as GrassWhistle.
When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Grass Whistle turns into Z-Grass Whistle and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Refresh.name: Refresh
description: Cures paralysis, poison, and burns.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Refresh turns into Z-Refresh and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Wring Out.name: Wring Out
description: Wring Out inflicts more damage when the opponent's HP is higher. At full HP its base power is 120 and it decreases in proportion - i.e. the power is:
Wring Out is a Special-category counterpart move to Crush Grip. It is also similar to Water Spout and Eruption, based on the opponent rather than the user.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wring Out turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190.

Grass Pledge.name: Grass Pledge
description: Grass Pledge deals damage at base power 80. If a teammate uses Fire Pledge or Water Pledge in the same turn, the moves combine into one attack of base power 160 and added effects appear.
The faster Pokémon moves first but waits for the other Pokémon to make their move. When the slower Pledge user moves, the combo attack hits the Pokémon the slower user was targeting.

If Grass Pledge is used with Fire Pledge, the move animation shows Fire Pledge and a sea of fire envelops the foe's team is created that damages opponents 1⁄8 of their maximum HP each turn, for 4 turns.
If Grass Pledge is used with Water Pledge, the move animation shows Grass Pledge and a swamp envelops the foe's team that halves the opponents' speed for 4 turns.
In Generation 5, Grass Pledge has 50 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Grass Pledge turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 160.

Captivate.name: Captivate
description: Captivate lowers the Special Attack of the target by two stages, if they are of the opposite gender to the user. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Captivate will fail if both Pokémon are the same gender, either Pokémon is genderless, or the target has the ability Oblivious.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Captivate turns into Z-Captivate and raises Special Defense two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Secret Power.name: Secret Power
description: Secret Power deals damage and has a 30% chance of inducing a secondary effect on the opponent, depending on the environment. The move's animation also changes, reusing that of a specific attack for each terrain.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Secret Power turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.
In Ruby, Sapphire, Emerald, Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire, Secret Power allows the user to create their own secret base when used on weeping willow-like trees or indented walls.

Hidden Power.name: Hidden Power
description: Hidden Power deals damage, however its type varies for every Pokémon, depending on that Pokémon's Individual Values (IVs). This makes it a useful move for coverage - giving the Pokémon a type of move they don't normally have.
Hidden Power can be any type except Normal or Fairy. It receives STAB if the user's type matches the type given to Hidden Power.
Individual Values are 6 hidden numbers (one for each stat) that are randomly generated upon encountering a Pokémon. It is not possible to find your exact IVs in-game.
You can find the type of Hidden Power in-game by talking to a particular character who will state the type a Pokémon's Hidden Power would be if it learned the move. They are located at:
Veilstone Game Corner (Prize Exchange) in Platinum
Celadon Game Corner (Prize Exchange) in HeartGold/SoulSilver
Mistralton City (PokéCenter) in Black/White
Pokémon World Tournament in Black 2/White 2
Anistar City (southeasternmost house) in X/Y.
Fortree City (northwest) in Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire.
Paniola Ranch (in the Pokémon Nursery) in Sun/Moon.
It is also possible to determine via elimination by using the move against different Pokémon, or against Kecleon, whose ability Color Change will tell you the type.
In Generations 2-3, Hidden Power is categorized as Physical.

In Generations 2-5, the base power of Hidden Power ranges from 30-70, depending on the user's IVs. The move will be boosted by the ability Technician only if its power for that Pokémon is 60 or below.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hidden Power turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 120.

Frustration.name: Frustration
description: The power of Frustration is higher when the Pokémon likes its trainer less. The base power varies between 1 (maximum Friendship) and 102 (minimum Friendship). The exact formula is:
Pokémon Friendship (aka Happiness) is a value between 0 and 255 (more details).
Frustration is the counterpart move to Return.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Frustration turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.

Return.name: Return
description: The power of Return is higher when the user likes its trainer more. The base power varies between 1 (minimum Friendship) and 102 (maximum Friendship). The exact formula is:
Pokémon Friendship (aka Happiness) is a value between 0 and 255 (more details).
Return is the counterpart move to Frustration.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Return turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.

Confide.name: Confide
description: Confide lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Confide turns into Z-Confide and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Eruption.name: Eruption
description: Eruption inflicts more damage when the user's HP is higher. At full HP its base power is 150 and it decreases in proportion - i.e. the power is:
Eruption is a counterpart move to Water Spout. It is also similar to Crush Grip and Wring Out, based on the user rather than the opponent.
When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Eruption turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 200.

Infernal Parade.name: Infernal Parade
description: The user attacks with myriad fireballs. This may also leave the target with a burn. This move’s power is doubled if the target has a status condition.

Chip Away.name: Chip Away
description: Chip Away deals damage, but ignores changes to the target's stats (i.e. Defense and Evasion in this case).
Note this does not include the effects of screens like Reflect as they are different to regular stat boosts.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Chip Away turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.

Mud Sport.name: Mud Sport
description: Mud Sport reduces the power of Electric type moves by 50%. The effect applies to the entire field.
Most Pokémon that learn Mud Sport are part Ground type and thus already immune to Electric attacks.
When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mud Sport turns into Z-Mud Sport and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Water Sport.name: Water Sport
description: Water Sport reduces the power of Fire-type moves by 50%. The effect applies to the entire field.
Most Pokémon that learn Water Sport are part Water type and thus already resistant to Fire attacks.
When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Water Sport turns into Z-Water Sport and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Water Pledge.name: Water Pledge
description: Water Pledge deals damage at base power 80. If a teammate uses Grass Pledge or Fire Pledge in the same turn, the moves combine into one attack of base power 160 and added effects appear.
The faster Pokémon moves first but waits for the other Pokémon to make their move. When the slower Pledge user moves, the combo attack hits the Pokémon the slower user was targeting.
If Water Pledge is used with Grass Pledge, the move animation shows Grass Pledge and a swamp envelops the foe's team that halves the opponents' speed for 4 turns.

If Water Pledge is used with Fire Pledge, the move animation shows Water Pledge and a rainbow appears in the sky on your team's side that doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring for 4 turns.
In Generation 5, Water Pledge has 50 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Water Pledge turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 160.

Foresight.name: Foresight
description: Resets opponent's Evasiveness, Normal-type and Fighting-type attacks can now hit Ghosts, and Ghost-type attacks hit Normal.
In Generations 2-3, Foresight has 100% accuracy.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Foresight turns into Z-Foresight and raises critical-hit ratio one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Me First.name: Me First
description: If the opponent is readying a direct attack, the user of Me First will try to copy it and attack with 50% more power. The move only works if the user is faster than the opponent or otherwise able to move first (for example a Quick Claw activating).
Me First cannot copy Sucker Punch or Fake Out, nor by its definition above, any high priority move such as ExtremeSpeed. However it can copy a multi-turn move from any of its turns.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Me First turns into Z-Me First and raises Speed two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Assist.name: Assist
description: Assist uses a random move known by any of the user's party Pokémon.
Assist will not select a Z-Move or any of the following moves:
Assist
Baneful Bunker
Beak Blast
Belch
Bestow
Bounce
Chatter
Circle Throw
Copycat
Counter
Covet
Destiny Bond
Detect
Dig
Dive
Dragon Tail
Endure
Feint
Fly
Focus Punch
Follow Me
Helping Hand
Hold Hands
Kings Shield
Mat Block
Me First
Metronome
Mimic
Mirror Coat
Mirror Move
Nature Power
Phantom Force
Protect
Rage Powder
Roar
Shadow Force
Shell Trap
Sketch
Skydrop
Sleep Talk
Snatch
Spiky Shield
Spotlight
Struggle
Switcheroo
Thief
Transform
Trick
Whirlwind
In Generation 5, Assist can use moves that a Pokémon in an egg will know upon hatching.

When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Assist turns into Z-Assist and becomes the Z-Move for the move selected (for example All-Out Pummeling if Brick Break was chosen), in addition to its usual effect as above.

Pursuit.name: Pursuit
description: Pursuit deals damage, and hits with double power if the target is switching out.
In that case, Pursuit technically has priority +7, meaning it attacks before all other actions and moves.
In Generations 2-3, Pursuit is categorized as Special.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Pursuit turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 100.

Comet Punch.name: Comet Punch
description: Comet Punch hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.
Each strike of Comet Punch is treated like a separate attack:
Each strike can get a critical hit independently.
Abilities that activate on contact (Static, Weak Armor, Iron Barbs etc.) activate for each strike.
If the Sturdy ability, Focus Sash, or Focus Band activates before the final hit, the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the opponent to faint.
If the first hit breaks a Substitute, the second hit will deal damage to the target Pokémon.
The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.
The Skill Link ability will cause Comet Punch to always hit the maximum number of times.
In Generations 2-4, if a Focus Sash or Focus Band activates before the final hit, subsequent hits do not cause the holder to faint.
In Generations 1-3, Comet Punch ends immediately if any hit breaks a Substitute.
In Generation 1, each hit will always deal the same damage - if the first critical hits, so will the rest.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Comet Punch turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

Bide.name: Bide
description: The user of Bide stores energy for 2 turns. At the end of the second turn the Pokémon unleashes energy, dealing twice the HP damage it received.

Bide deals fixed, typeless damage, so will hit Ghost-type Pokémon. It also ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats and can hit Pokémon in the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.
In double and triple battles, Bide hits the last Pokémon to attack the user (including teammates).
In Generations 2-3, Bide has 100% accuracy.
In Generations 1-3, Bide has a priority of 0.
In Generations 1-3, Bide stores energy for 2-3 turns.
In Generations 2-3, Bide does not hit Ghost-type Pokémon.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bide turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

Dizzy Punch.name: Dizzy Punch
description: Dizzy Punch deals damage and has a 20% chance of confusing the target.
Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
In Generation 1, Dizzy Punch does not cause confusion.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dizzy Punch turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.

Infestation.name: Infestation
description: Infestation inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns.
If the user holds a Grip Claw, the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1⁄6 of the target's maximum HP.
When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Infestation turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 100.

Sticky Web.name: Sticky Web
description: Sticky Web sets up a sticky net around the opposing team, which lowers the Speed of Pokémon switching into battle by one stage.
Raised Pokémon switching in are not affected. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary.
When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sticky Web turns into Z-Sticky Web and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Toxic Thread.name: Toxic Thread
description: Toxic Thread poisons the target, and lowers its Speed by one stage.
Each effect still occurs if the other cannot, for example a Poison type Pokémon will still have its Speed reduced. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Toxic Thread turns into Z-Toxic Thread and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Constrict.name: Constrict
description: Constrict deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Speed by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Constrict turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

Spider Web.name: Spider Web
description: Opponent cannot escape/switch.
When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spider Web turns into Z-Spider Web and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Signal Beam.name: Signal Beam
description: Signal Beam deals damage and has a 10% chance of confusing the target.
Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
In Generation 3, Signal Beam is categorized as Physical.
When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Signal Beam turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 140.

Sonic Boom.name: Sonic Boom
description: Sonic Boom always deals 20 HP damage to the target, regardless of typing (although Ghost type Pokémon are still immune). It has no additional effect.
In Generations 1-3, Sonic Boom is categorized as Physical.
In Generations 1-5, this move's name is formatted as SonicBoom.
In Generation 1, Sonic Boom hits Ghost types regardless of their immunity to Normal type moves.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sonic Boom turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

Cotton Spore.name: Cotton Spore
description: Cotton Spore lowers the target's Speed by two stages.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
In Generations 1-4, Cotton Spore has 85% accuracy.
When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Cotton Spore turns into Z-Cotton Spore and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Cotton Guard.name: Cotton Guard
description: Cotton Guard raises the user's Defense by three stages.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Assuming no other stat changes, the first use of Cotton Guard would raise Defense to 2.5× normal value, and the second to 4× (the maximum level).
When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Cotton Guard turns into Z-Cotton Guard and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Odor Sleuth.name: Odor Sleuth
description: Resets opponent's Evasiveness, Normal-type and Fighting-type attacks can now hit Ghosts, and Ghost-type attacks hit Normal.
In Generation 3, Odor Sleuth has 100% accuracy.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Odor Sleuth turns into Z-Odor Sleuth and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Ion Deluge.name: Ion Deluge
description: Ion Deluge changes Normal-type moves to Electric-type for all Pokémon on the field, for the remainder of the turn.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ion Deluge turns into Z-Ion Deluge and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Tearful Look.name: Tearful Look
description: The user gets teary eyed to make the target lose its combative spirit. This lowers the target's Attack and Sp. Atk stats. (100% chance)
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tearful Look turns into Z-Tearful Look and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Mud Bomb.name: Mud Bomb
description: Mud Bomb deals damage and has a 30% chance of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mud Bomb turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 120.

Flower Shield.name: Flower Shield
description: Flower Shield raises the Defense of all Grass-type Pokémon in battle (including opponents) by one stage.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flower Shield turns into Z-Flower Shield and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Eerie Spell.name: Eerie Spell
description: Eerie Spell deals damage and reduces the PP of the target's last-used move by 3.

Telekinesis.name: Telekinesis
description: Telekinesis raises the target into the air for three turns, guaranteeing that all attacks against the target (except OHKO moves) will hit, regardless of Accuracy or Evasion.
The target gains the usual benefits of being raised, e.g. immunity to Ground-type moves. More details, including when Telekinesis can't be used, are in the glossary.
The effect is cancelled if the raised Pokémon is hit by Smack Down.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Telekinesis turns into Z-Telekinesis and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Nightmare.name: Nightmare
description: If the target is asleep, Nightmare causes it to lose 1⁄4 of its maximum HP after each turn. The status condition is cured when the Pokémon wakes up.
In Generations 2-3, Nightmare always hits.
When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Nightmare turns into Z-Nightmare and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Mirror Shot.name: Mirror Shot
description: Mirror Shot deals damage and has a 30% chance of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mirror Shot turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 120.

Feint Attack.name: Feint Attack
description: Feint Attack deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.
In Generations 2-3, Feint Attack is categorized as Special.
In Generations 2-5, this move's name is formatted as Faint Attack.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Feint Attack turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 120.

Smelling Salts.name: Smelling Salts
description: Smelling Salts deals damage, and hits with double power (140) if the target is paralyzed. However, it also cures the paralysis.
In Generations 3-5, Smelling Salts has 60 base power.
In Generations 3-5, this move's name is formatted as SmellingSalt.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Smelling Salts turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.

Barb Barrage.name: Barb Barrage
description: The user launches countless toxic barbs to inflict damage. This may also poison the target. This move’s power is doubled if the target has a status condition.

Flame Burst.name: Flame Burst
description: Flame Burst deals damage and will also cause splash damage to any Pokémon adjacent to the target (including the user if Flame Burst is targeted at an ally).
The splash damage caused to a Pokémon is 1⁄16 of its maximum HP. It is typeless and not counted as regular damage but treated similarly to weather damage, which means that:
It does not trigger Flash Fire or Color Change.
It does not affect Pokémon with the Magic Guard ability.
It cannot be shielded by moves like Protect, Endure or other protection moves.
It bypasses Wonder Guard, Mold Breaker, Telepathy, Substitute and Destiny Bond.
When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flame Burst turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 140.

Aurora Veil.name: Aurora Veil
description: Aurora Veil halves damage from Physical and Special attacks for five turns.
When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aurora Veil turns into Z-Aurora Veil and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Embargo.name: Embargo
description: Embargo prevents the target using any items for five turns. This includes both held items and items used by the trainer such as medicines.
In Generation 4, Magic Coat does not deflect the effect of Embargo.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Embargo turns into Z-Embargo and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Punishment.name: Punishment
description: Punishment deals varying damage based on the opponent's stat increases. It starts at base power 60 and increases by 20 for every net stat boost of the opponent, up to a maximum of 200 (7 boosts). In other words the power is:
For example, if the opponent used Nasty Plot and Agility once each, that is a total of 4 stat increases (+2 Special Attack, +2 Speed) and Punishment's base power will be 20 × 4 + 60 = 140.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Punishment turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160.

Snatch.name: Snatch
description: Snatch moves first and steals the effects of the next status move used by the opponent(s) in that turn. If two or more Pokémon use Snatch, the slowest of the Pokémon will gain the effect, because the fastest Pokémon will steal the move first, then the next slowest will steal the move from the snatcher and so on.
Moves that can be snatched:
Stat boosts, for example Swords Dance or Belly Drum (exceptions below)
Protection moves, for example Substitute, Lucky Chant, Wide Guard or Quick Guard (exceptions below)
Recovery and healing moves, for example Recover, Ingrain or Heal Bell
Imprison
Other self-induced effects such as Magnet Rise, Power Trick or Light Screen
Moves that cannot be snatched:
Acupressure
Curse
Protect or Detect
Helping Hand
Taunt
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Snatch turns into Z-Snatch and raises Speed two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Magnitude.name: Magnitude
description: The base power of Magnitude is one of 7 random values, with varying probability, as shown in the table.
Magnitude will hit with double power if the opponent is underground due to the move Dig.
When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Magnitude turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 140.

Psyshield Bash.name: Psyshield Bash
description: Cloaking itself in psychic energy, the user slams into the target. This may also raise the user’s defensive stats.

Sketch.name: Sketch
description: Permanently copies the opponent's last move.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sketch turns into Z-Sketch and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Triple Kick.name: Triple Kick
description: Triple Kick deals damage and will strike three times, with each kick's base power increasing by 10. In other words the blows will be base power 10, 20 and 30 - a total of 60.

Each hit has its own accuracy check, and if one kick misses, the move ends. Therefore, the chances of it being successful for each number of hits (with normal Accuracy/Evasion) are 90%, 81% and 73% respectively.
Each strike of Triple Kick is treated like a separate attack:
Each strike can get a critical hit independently.
Abilities that activate on contact (Static, Weak Armor, Iron Barbs etc.) activate for each strike.
If the Sturdy ability, Focus Sash, or Focus Band activates before the final hit, the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the opponent to faint.
If the first hit breaks a Substitute, the second hit will deal damage to the target Pokémon.
The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.
In Generations 2-4, if a Focus Sash or Focus Band activates before the final hit, subsequent hits do not cause the holder to faint.
In Generations 2-3, Triple Kick ends immediately if any hit breaks a Substitute.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Triple Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120.

Milk Drink.name: Milk Drink
description: Milk Drink recovers up to 50% of the user's maximum HP.
