When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Milk Drink turns into Z-Milk Drink and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
In the field, using Milk Drink will take away 20% of the user's maximum HP and give it to another Pokémon. (It is unusable if the user's HP is below 20%.)

Sacred Fire.name: Sacred Fire
description: Sacred Fire deals damage and has a 50% chance of burning the target.
Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.
If the user is frozen, Sacred Fire can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking.
In Generations 2-3, Sacred Fire is categorized as Special.
When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sacred Fire turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 180.

Aeroblast.name: Aeroblast
description: Aeroblast deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24).
Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor, or those under the effects of Lucky Chant, are protected against critical hits.
In Generations 2-3, Aeroblast is categorized as Physical.
When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aeroblast turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 180.

Leafage.name: Leafage
description: Strikes opponent with leaves.
When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leafage turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 100.

Boomburst.name: Boomburst
description: Boomburst deals massive damage and targets all adjacent Pokémon in battle, including allies.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Boomburst turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 200.

Wake-Up Slap.name: Wake-Up Slap
description: Wake-Up Slap deals damage, and hits with double power (140) if the target is asleep. However, it also wakes up the target.
In Generations 4-5, Wake-Up Slap has 60 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wake-Up Slap turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 140.

Force Palm.name: Force Palm
description: Force Palm deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target.
Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Force Palm turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120.

Sky Uppercut.name: Sky Uppercut
description: Hits the opponent, even during Fly.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sky Uppercut turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 160.

Arm Thrust.name: Arm Thrust
description: Arm Thrust hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.
Each strike of Arm Thrust is treated like a separate attack:
Each strike can get a critical hit independently.
Abilities that activate on contact (Static, Weak Armor, Iron Barbs etc.) activate for each strike.
If the Sturdy ability, Focus Sash, or Focus Band activates before the final hit, the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the opponent to faint.
If the first hit breaks a Substitute, the second hit will deal damage to the target Pokémon.
The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.
The Skill Link ability will cause Arm Thrust to always hit the maximum number of times.
In Generations 3-4, if a Focus Sash or Focus Band activates before the final hit, subsequent hits do not cause the holder to faint.
In Generation 3, Arm Thrust ends immediately if any hit breaks a Substitute.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Arm Thrust turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.

Double Slap.name: Double Slap
description: Double Slap hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.
Each strike of Double Slap is treated like a separate attack:
Each strike can get a critical hit independently.
Abilities that activate on contact (Static, Weak Armor, Iron Barbs etc.) activate for each strike.
If the Sturdy ability, Focus Sash, or Focus Band activates before the final hit, the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the opponent to faint.
If the first hit breaks a Substitute, the second hit will deal damage to the target Pokémon.
The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.
The Skill Link ability will cause Double Slap to always hit the maximum number of times.
In Generations 1-5, this move's name is formatted as DoubleSlap.
In Generations 2-4, if a Focus Sash or Focus Band activates before the final hit, subsequent hits do not cause the holder to faint.
In Generations 1-3, Double Slap ends immediately if any hit breaks a Substitute.
In Generation 1, each hit will always deal the same damage - if the first critical hits, so will the rest.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Double Slap turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

Bestow.name: Bestow
description: Bestow gives the user's held item to the target.
It will not work if the target is already holding an item or is behind a Substitute. Mail cannot be transferred.

Items bestowed upon wild Pokémon are permanently lost if the Pokémon is KO'd, but items lost in Trainer battles are returned. All held items in wi-fi/linked battles (including Battle Tower/Subway/Maison) are returned to their respective owners at the end of a battle.

Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bestow turns into Z-Bestow and raises Speed two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Lucky Chant.name: Lucky Chant
description: Opponent cannot land critical hits for 5 turns.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Lucky Chant turns into Z-Lucky Chant and raises Evasiveness one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Trump Card.name: Trump Card
description: Trump Card inflicts more damage when fewer PP are left, as per the table. The power is calculated based on the PP remaining after the move has been used; this is to account for the ability Pressure which deducts 2 PP for each move.
If Trump Card is selected via a different move such as Metronome or Sleep Talk, it uses the PP of that move to determine the power.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Trump Card turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.

Tail Glow.name: Tail Glow
description: Tail Glow raises the user's Special Attack by three stages.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Assuming no other stat changes, the first use of Tail Glow would raise Special Attack to 2.5× normal value, and the second to 4× (the maximum level).
In Generations 3-4, Tail Glow increases Special Attack by two stages.
When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tail Glow turns into Z-Tail Glow and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Noble Roar.name: Noble Roar
description: Noble Roar lowers the target's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Noble Roar turns into Z-Noble Roar and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Psywave.name: Psywave
description: Psywave inflicts a random amount of HP damage, varying between 50% and 150% of the user's level. In other words, at level 100 the damage will be 50-150 HP.
The damage is typeless (not affected by type advantages/disadvantages) but it still does not hit Dark type Pokémon.
In Generations 1-5, Psywave has 80% accuracy.
In Generation 1, Psywave deals damage between 100% and 150% of the user's level; in Generation 2, the damage is between 0% and 150% of the user's level (minimum 1 HP).
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psywave turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 100.

Spotlight.name: Spotlight
description: The user shines a spotlight on the target so that only the target will be attacked during the turn.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spotlight turns into Z-Spotlight and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Needle Arm.name: Needle Arm
description: Needle Arm deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).
Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
In Generation 3, Needle Arm is categorized as Special.
In Generation 3 if the target has used Minimize, Needle Arm deals double damage.
When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Needle Arm turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 120.

Rototiller.name: Rototiller
description: Rototiller raises the Attack and Special Attack of any Grass-type Pokémon on the field by one stage each.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rototiller turns into Z-Rototiller and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Spiky Shield.name: Spiky Shield
description: Spiky Shield prevents any attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. If a contact move is targeted at the Spiky Shield user on that turn, the attacker receives damage of 1⁄8 their maximum HP. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves.
Contact damage does not stack with the Rocky Helmet item or the Rough Skin or Iron Barbs abilities.
The accuracy of Spiky Shield drops by 1⁄3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect, Detect, Endure, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, King's Shield, or Baneful Bunker.
When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spiky Shield turns into Z-Spiky Shield and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Camouflage.name: Camouflage
description: Camouflage causes the user to change its type based on the current terrain:
Normal type in buildings, paved/plain terrain or wi-fi/linked battles.
Grass type in standard grassy areas or when Grassy Terrain is in effect.
Ground type in desert, beaches or rocky terrain.
Rock type in caves.
Water type when surfing on water or diving underwater.
Ice type in snow or icy caves.
Fire type in volcanic areas.
Flying type when soaring or at the Sky Pillar (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire).
Ghost type when at Mt. Pyre (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire).
Dragon type when in Space (Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire).
Fairy type when Misty Terrain is in effect.
Electric type when Electric Terrain is in effect.
Psychic type when Psychic Terrain is in effect, or in Ultra Space (Sun/Moon/US/UM).
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Camouflage turns into Z-Camouflage and raises Evasiveness one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Synchronoise.name: Synchronoise
description: Synchronoise hits all adjacent Pokémon that share a type with the user. Dual type Pokémon match either of their types, so for example a Normal/Flying Pokémon using Synchronoise will hit a Flying/Dragon type.
In Generation 5, Synchronoise has 70 base power.
In Generation 5, Synchronoise has 15 PP.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Synchronoise turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 190.

Frost Breath.name: Frost Breath
description: Frost Breath deals damage and always results in a critical hit, increasing its power to 90.
Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor, or those under the effect of Lucky Chant are immune to critical hits so Frost Breath will hit them with base power 60.
In Generation 5, Frost Breath has 40 base power.
In Generation 5, critical hits increase power by 2× rather than 1.5× so the effective power of Frost Breath is 80 with the critical hit.
When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Frost Breath turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 120.

Clamp.name: Clamp
description: Clamp inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns.
If the user holds a Grip Claw, the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1⁄6 of the target's maximum HP.
In Generations 1-3, Clamp is categorized as Special.
In Generations 1-4, Clamp has 75% accuracy.
In Generations 1-4, Clamp has 10 PP.
In Generations 1-4, the after-effects of Clamp last for 2-5 turns instead of 4-5; holding Grip Claw they last for 5 turns.
In Generations 2-5, the target loses only 1⁄16 of their maximum HP after each turn, or 1⁄8 if a Binding Band is held.
In Generation 1, Clamp inflicts regular damage for 2-5 turns. While in effect, the target is unable to attack.
When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Clamp turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 100.

Heart Stamp.name: Heart Stamp
description: Heart Stamp deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).
Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heart Stamp turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 120.

Mist Ball.name: Mist Ball
description: Mist Ball deals damage and has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Special Attack by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mist Ball turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 140.

Luster Purge.name: Luster Purge
description: Luster Purge deals damage and has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Luster Purge turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 140.

Origin Pulse.name: Origin Pulse
description: Origin Pulse deals damage and hits all adjacent opponents in double/triple battles.
It is the signature move of Kyogre.
When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Origin Pulse turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 185.

Precipice Blades.name: Precipice Blades
description: Precipice Blades deals damage and hits all adjacent opponents in double/triple battles.
It is the signature move of Groudon.
When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Precipice Blades turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 190.

Dragon Ascent.name: Dragon Ascent
description: Dragon Ascent deals damage but lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each after attacking.
It is the signature move of Rayquaza, and once learned allows Rayquaza to Mega-Evolve.
When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Ascent turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 190.

Doom Desire.name: Doom Desire
description: Two turns after the move is selected, Doom Desire will deal damage. If the opponent switched Pokémon in the meantime, the damage dealt will depend on the Special Defense of the Pokémon the move hits, not the Pokémon it was originally targeted at.
In Generation 3, Doom Desire is categorized as Physical.
In Generations 3-4, Doom Desire has 120 base power.
In Generations 3-4, Doom Desire has 85% accuracy.

In Generations 3-4, Doom Desire deals typeless damage. Furthermore, it uses the Special Defense (Gen 4) or Defense (Gen 3) stat of the originally targeted Pokémon, even if it switched out in the meantime.
When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Doom Desire turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 200.

Psycho Boost.name: Psycho Boost
description: Psycho Boost deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psycho Boost turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 200.

Headlong Rush.name: Headlong Rush
description: The user smashes into the target in a full-body tackle. This also lowers the user’s defensive stats.

Wave Crash.name: Wave Crash
description: The user shrouds itself in water and slams into the target with its whole body to inflict damage. This also damages the user and raises the user’s action speed.

Attack Order.name: Attack Order
description: Attack Order deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24).
Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor, or those under the effects of Lucky Chant, are protected against critical hits.
When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Attack Order turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 175.

Defend Order.name: Defend Order
description: Defend Order raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Defend Order turns into Z-Defend Order and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Chatter.name: Chatter
description: Chatter deals damage and causes the target to become confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack.
Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
In Generations 4-5, Chatter has 60 base power.

In Generations 4-5, the player's voice can be recorded and this recording is played back when the move is used. The louder the recording, the more likely Chatter is to cause confusion. The chance of confusion can be 1%, 11% or 31% for a low, medium or high volume respectively.
Chatot was previously banned from online play due to the possibility of inappropriate phrases being recorded with Chatter (although the recording is always somewhat distorted).
When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Chatter turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 120.

Rock Wrecker.name: Rock Wrecker
description: User must recharge next turn.
When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Wrecker turns into Continental Crush and has base power 200.

Mystical Power.name: Mystical Power
description: Mystical Power deals damage, then raises the user's Attack and Special Attack if those stats are higher, or raises Defense and Special Defense if those stats are higher.

Roar of Time.name: Roar of Time
description: User must recharge next turn.
When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Roar of Time turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 200.

Spacial Rend.name: Spacial Rend
description: Spacial Rend deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24).
When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spacial Rend turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 180.

Magma Storm.name: Magma Storm
description: Magma Storm inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns.
If the user holds a Grip Claw, the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1⁄6 of the target's maximum HP.
In Generations 4-5, Magma Storm has 120 base power.
In Generation 4, Magma Storm has 70% accuracy.
In Generation 4, the after-effects of Magma Storm last for 2-5 turns instead of 4-5; holding Grip Claw they last for 5 turns.
In Generations 4-5, the target loses only 1⁄16 of their maximum HP after each turn, or 1⁄8 if a Binding Band is held.
When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Magma Storm turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 180.

Crush Grip.name: Crush Grip
description: Crush Grip inflicts more damage when the opponent's HP is higher. At full HP its base power is 120 and it decreases in proportion - i.e. the power is:
Crush Grip is a Physical-category counterpart move to Wring Out. It is also similar to Water Spout and Eruption, based on the opponent rather than the user.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Crush Grip turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190.

Shadow Force.name: Shadow Force
description: The user of Shadow Force will vanish instantly on the first turn, disappearing from view and becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, Shadow Force deals damage and can hit Pokémon using Protect or Detect. It also removes their effect for the rest of the turn (in double and triple battles).
While disappeared, the Pokémon can only be hit by moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move.
If the user is holding a Power Herb, Shadow Force executes in one turn.
In Generation 6 if the target has used Minimize, Shadow Force ignores accuracy and deals double damage.
When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shadow Force turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 190.

Lunar Dance.name: Lunar Dance
description: The user faints but the next Pokémon released is fully healed.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Lunar Dance has no additional effect.

Lunar Blessing.name: Lunar Blessing
description: The user heals its own status conditions and restores its HP. Incoming moves also become more likely to miss.

Take Heart.name: Take Heart
description: The user lifts its spirits, healing its own status conditions and raising its offensive and defensive stats.

Heart Swap.name: Heart Swap
description: Stat changes are swapped with the opponent.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heart Swap turns into Z-Heart Swap and raises critical-hit ratio one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Dark Void.name: Dark Void
description: Dark Void puts the target(s) to sleep. It can only be used by Darkrai.

It targets all adjacent opponents i.e. the opposing Pokémon in a single battle, both opponents in a double battle, three opponents if in the center of a triple battle, or two opponents if situated at the side in a triple battle. Each target is counted as a separate attack so it may succeed for all, any or none of the targets.
Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns.
Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.
In Generations 4-6, Dark Void has 80% accuracy.
In Generations 4-6, Dark Void is usable by other Pokémon if selected via Metronome, Assist, or Sketched by Smeargle.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dark Void turns into Z-Dark Void and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Seed Flare.name: Seed Flare
description: Seed Flare deals damage and has a 40% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by two stages.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Seed Flare turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 190.

Judgment.name: Judgment
description: Type depends on the Arceus Plate being held.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Judgment turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 180.

V-create.name: V-create
description: V-create deals damage but lowers the user's Defense, Special Defense and Speed by one stage each after attacking.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, V-create turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 220.

Searing Shot.name: Searing Shot
description: Searing Shot deals damage and has a 30% chance of burning the target.
Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.
When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Searing Shot turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 180.

Blue Flare.name: Blue Flare
description: Blue Flare deals damage and has a 20% chance of burning the target.
Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.
When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Blue Flare turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 195.

Bolt Strike.name: Bolt Strike
description: Bolt Strike deals damage and has a 20% chance of paralyzing the target.
Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bolt Strike turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 195.

Fusion Bolt.name: Fusion Bolt
description: Fusion Bolt deals damage, and its power doubles to 200 if Fusion Flare has been used before it in the same turn. If this happens Fusion Bolt's animation will change to look more epic.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fusion Bolt turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 180.

Fusion Flare.name: Fusion Flare
description: Fusion Flare deals damage, and its power doubles to 200 if Fusion Bolt has been used before it in the same turn. If this happens Fusion Flare's animation will change to look more epic.
If the user is frozen, Fusion Flare can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking.
When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fusion Flare turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 180.

Glaciate.name: Glaciate
description: Glaciate deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Glaciate turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 120.

Fire Pledge.name: Fire Pledge
description: Fire Pledge deals damage at base power 80. If a teammate uses Grass Pledge or Water Pledge in the same turn, the moves combine into one attack of base power 160 and added effects appear.
The faster Pokémon moves first but waits for the other Pokémon to make their move. When the slower Pledge user moves, the combo attack hits the Pokémon the slower user was targeting.

If Fire Pledge is used with Grass Pledge, the move animation shows Fire Pledge and a sea of fire envelops the foe's team is created that damages opponents 1⁄8 of their maximum HP each turn, for 4 turns.

If Fire Pledge is used with Water Pledge, the move animation shows Water Pledge and a rainbow appears in the sky on your team's side that doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring for 4 turns.
In Generation 5, Fire Pledge has 50 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fire Pledge turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 160.

Sacred Sword.name: Sacred Sword
description: Sacred Sword deals damage, but ignores changes to the target's stats (i.e. Defense and Evasion in this case).
Note this does not include the effects of screens like Reflect as they are different to regular stat boosts.
In Generation 5, Sacred Sword has 20 PP.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sacred Sword turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 175.

Ceaseless Edge.name: Ceaseless Edge
description: The user slashes its shell blade at the target, aiming to land a critical hit. Shell splinters left behind by this attack will continue to damage the target for several turns.

Mat Block.name: Mat Block
description: Mat Block protects the user's team from Physical or Special category moves, but not Status moves. It only works on the first turn the user is in battle.
In Generation 6, Mat Block has 15 PP.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mat Block turns into Z-Mat Block and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Steamroller.name: Steamroller
description: Steamroller deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).
Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
If the target has used Minimize, Steamroller ignores accuracy and deals double damage.
In Generation 5 accuracy is not bypassed against a Minimize user.
When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Steamroller turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 120.

Victory Dance.name: Victory Dance
description: The user performs a dance to usher in victory. This raises the user’s offensive and defensive stats and increases the damage dealt by the user’s moves by 50 percent.

Power Trip.name: Power Trip
description: The user boasts its strength and attacks the target. The more the user's stats are raised, the greater the move's power.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power Trip turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160.

Miracle Eye.name: Miracle Eye
description: Resets opponent's Evasiveness, removes Dark's Psychic immunity.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Miracle Eye turns into Z-Miracle Eye and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Crafty Shield.name: Crafty Shield
description: Crafty Shield protects the user's team from any Status category move targeted at them, for the duration of the turn. It has priority +3 so will activate before most other moves.
It does not protect against the moves Perish Song, Spikes, Stealth Rock, Toxic Spikes, or Sticky Web; and it does not prevent moves that target the attacker itself (such as Rest).
When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Crafty Shield turns into Z-Crafty Shield and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Heal Block.name: Heal Block
description: Prevents the opponent from restoring HP for 5 turns.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heal Block turns into Z-Heal Block and raises Special Attack two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Night Daze.name: Night Daze
description: Night Daze deals damage and has a 40% chance of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Night Daze turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160.

Bitter Malice.name: Bitter Malice
description: The user attacks its target with spine-chilling resentment. This may also leave the target with frostbite. This move’s power is doubled if the target has a status condition.

Horn Leech.name: Horn Leech
description: Horn Leech deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained.

If the user is holding a Big Root, the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.
When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Horn Leech turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 140.

Gear Grind.name: Gear Grind
description: Gear Grind deals damage and will strike twice (with 50 base power each time).
Each strike of Gear Grind is treated like a separate attack:
Each strike can get a critical hit independently.
Abilities that activate on contact (Static, Weak Armor, Iron Barbs etc.) activate for each strike.
If the Sturdy ability, Focus Sash, or Focus Band activates before the final hit, the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the opponent to faint.
If the first hit breaks a Substitute, the second hit will deal damage to the target Pokémon.
The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.
When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gear Grind turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 180.

Shift Gear.name: Shift Gear
description: Shift Gear raises the user's Attack by one stage and Speed by two stages.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shift Gear turns into Z-Shift Gear and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Gear Up.name: Gear Up
description: The user engages its gears to raise the Attack and Sp. Atk stats of ally Pokémon with the Plus or Minus Ability.
When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gear Up turns into Z-Gear Up and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Dragon Rage.name: Dragon Rage
description: Dragon Rage always deals 40 HP damage to the target, regardless of typing. It has no additional effect.
When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Rage turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 100.

Sharpen.name: Sharpen
description: Sharpen raises the user's Attack by one stage.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sharpen turns into Z-Sharpen and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Water Shuriken.name: Water Shuriken
description: Water Shuriken attacks with increased priority.
Water Shuriken hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.
Each strike of Water Shuriken is treated like a separate attack:
Each strike can get a critical hit independently.
Abilities that activate on contact (Static, Weak Armor, Iron Barbs etc.) activate for each strike.
If the Sturdy ability, Focus Sash, or Focus Band activates before the final hit, the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the opponent to faint.
If the first hit breaks a Substitute, the second hit will deal damage to the target Pokémon.
The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.
The Skill Link ability will cause Water Shuriken to always hit the maximum number of times.
If Battle Bond is active, Water Shuriken always hits 3 times, each with 20 base power.
In Generation 6, Water Shuriken is categorized as Physical.
When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Water Shuriken turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 100.

Snap Trap.name: Snap Trap
description: Traps opponent, damaging them for 4-5 turns. (100% chance)

Head Charge.name: Head Charge
description: Head Charge deals damage, but the user receives 1⁄4 of the damage it inflicts in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 25 HP.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Head Charge turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190.

Esper Wing.name: Esper Wing
description: The user slashes the target with aura-enriched wings. This also raises the user’s action speed. This move has a heightened chance of landing a critical hit.

Fire Lash.name: Fire Lash
description: The user strikes the target with a burning lash. This also lowers the target's Defense stat. (100% chance)
When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fire Lash turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 160.

Fiery Dance.name: Fiery Dance
description: Fiery Dance deals damage and has a 50% chance of raising the user's Special Attack by one stage.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fiery Dance turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 160.

Bleakwind Storm.name: Bleakwind Storm
description: The user attacks with savagely cold winds that cause both body and spirit to tremble. This may also leave the target with frostbite.

Wildbolt Storm.name: Wildbolt Storm
description: The user summons a thunderous tempest and savagely attacks with lightning and wind. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

Sandsear Storm.name: Sandsear Storm
description: The user attacks by wrapping the target in fierce winds and searingly hot sand. This also leaves the target with a burn.

Ice Burn.name: Ice Burn
description: The user of Ice Burn will charge on the first turn. On the second turn, it deals damage and has a 30% chance of burning the target.
Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Ice Burn executes in one turn.
When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Burn turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 200.

Freeze Shock.name: Freeze Shock
description: The user of Freeze Shock will charge on the first turn. On the second turn, it deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target.
Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Freeze Shock executes in one turn.
When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Freeze Shock turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 200.

Secret Sword.name: Secret Sword
description: Inflicts damage based on the target's Defense, not Special Defense.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Secret Sword turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 160.

Relic Song.name: Relic Song
description: May put the target to sleep. (10% chance)
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Relic Song turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.

Techno Blast.name: Techno Blast
description: Techno Blast deals damage. Its type changes depending on the held Drive:
Normal type if no Drive is held.
Fire type if Burn Drive is held.
Ice type if Chill Drive is held.
Water type if Douse Drive is held.
Electric type if Shock Drive is held.
Techno Blast is the signature move of Genesect.
In Generation 5, Techno Blast has 85 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Techno Blast turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190.

Magnet Bomb.name: Magnet Bomb
description: Magnet Bomb deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.
When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Magnet Bomb turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 120.

Powder.name: Powder
description: Powder moves with priority and covers the target in a powder that lasts for the rest of the current turn only. It damages the target if they use a Fire type move in that turn, and prevents the Fire move from working.
When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Powder turns into Z-Powder and raises Special Defense two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Hold Hands.name: Hold Hands
description: Makes the user and an ally very happy.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hold Hands turns into Z-Hold Hands and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.

King's Shield.name: King's Shield
description: King's Shield prevents any Physical or Special attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. If a contact move is targeted at the King's Shield user, the opponent's Attack is lowered by two stages. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
The accuracy of King's Shield drops by 1⁄3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect, Detect, Endure, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, or Baneful Bunker.
When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, King's Shield turns into Z-King's Shield and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Topsy-Turvy.name: Topsy-Turvy
description: Topsy-Turvy reverses the stat changes of the target Pokémon.

For example, if the target has boosted their attack by 2 stages using Swords Dance, Topsy-Turvy will reduce their Attack down to -2 stages. Similarly, if the opponent has used Draco Meteor (lowering their Special Attack), Topsy-Turvy will raise their Special Attack to +2 stages.
In Generation 6, Topsy-Turvy has 100% accuracy.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Topsy-Turvy turns into Z-Topsy-Turvy and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Happy Hour.name: Happy Hour
description: Happy Hour has no battle effect. Instead, it doubles the prize money awarded to the player at the end of the battle. If the Amulet Coin or Luck Incense is held by any Pokémon in battle, and any Pokémon uses Happy Hour during the battle, the prize money is quadrupled.
Happy Hour is an event-exclusive move known by Inkay from a Japanese event.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Happy Hour turns into Z-Happy Hour and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Parabolic Charge.name: Parabolic Charge
description: Parabolic Charge deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained. It targets all adjacent Pokémon.
In Generation 6, Parabolic Charge has 50 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Parabolic Charge turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 120.

Electrify.name: Electrify
description: Electrify causes the target's move to become Electric type, if it has yet to attack during that turn.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Electrify turns into Z-Electrify and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Flying Press.name: Flying Press
description: Flying Press deals damage. It is a Fighting type move, but deals a combination of Fighting and Flying type damage. This in effect gives the move its own type chart, as shown below.
Although Flying Press deals dual type damage, it is still a pure Fighting type move so only gains STAB from Fighting type Pokémon.
If the target has used Minimize, Flying Press ignores accuracy and deals double damage.
In Generation 6, Flying Press has 80 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flying Press turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 170.

Sky Drop.name: Sky Drop
description: Sky Drop takes the target into the air on the first turn, then drops them on the second turn, wherein they receive damage.

While in the air, neither Pokémon can be hit, except by Gust, Hurricane, Sky Uppercut, Smack Down, Thunder or Twister. Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit.

Sky Drop will appear to work on Flying-types and those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis, but will not cause them any damage. It fails if Gravity is in effect, the target is holding an Iron Ball, or is behind a Substitute.

There is a glitch with Sky Drop in Black/White in double battles. If Gravity is put into effect while the Pokémon are in the air, the user of Sky Drop returns to the ground, but the target stays in the air and cannot attack or be hit (besides the moves noted above). Due to this, it was briefly banned from Wi-Fi battles and all official Pokémon competitions.
When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sky Drop turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 120.

Shelter.name: Shelter
description: The user makes its skin as hard as an iron shield, raising its defensive stats. Incoming moves also become more likely to miss.

Fairy Lock.name: Fairy Lock
description: Fairy Lock prevents all Pokémon on the field from fleeing during the following turn.
When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fairy Lock turns into Z-Fairy Lock and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Branch Poke.name: Branch Poke
description: Branch Poke has no added effects.

Forest's Curse.name: Forest's Curse
description: Forest's Curse adds the Grass type to the target. If the target is dual-typed they essentially become a triple-typed Pokémon.
It fails if one of the Pokémon's types is already Grass. If the target is under the effect of Trick-or-Treat the Ghost type is replaced by Grass.
When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Forest's Curse turns into Z-Forest's Curse and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Trick-or-Treat.name: Trick-or-Treat
description: Trick-or-Treat adds the Ghost type to the target. If the target is dual-typed they essentially become a triple-typed Pokémon.
It fails if one of the Pokémon's types is already Ghost. If the target is under the effect of Forest's Curse the Grass type is replaced by Ghost.
When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Trick-or-Treat turns into Z-Trick-or-Treat and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Mountain Gale.name: Mountain Gale
description: The user hurls giant chunks of ice at the target to inflict damage.

Geomancy.name: Geomancy
description: Geomancy charges on the first turn. On the second turn it raises the user's Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed by two stages each.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Geomancy is the signature move of Xerneas. In battle, rainbow-colored light erupts from the ground around the user.
When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Geomancy turns into Z-Geomancy and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Oblivion Wing.name: Oblivion Wing
description: Oblivion Wing deals damage and the user will recover 75% of the HP drained.
Oblivion Wing is the signature move of Yveltal. In battle, the user flies high into the sky then releases a beam of red light that scorches the ground.
When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Oblivion Wing turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 160.

Core Enforcer.name: Core Enforcer
description: Core Enforcer deals damage, and if the target has already moved this turn, suppresses the target's ability while it remains in battle.
When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Core Enforcer turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 140.

Thousand Arrows.name: Thousand Arrows
description: Thousand Arrows deals damage and knocks the target(s) to the ground. Any raised Pokémon now become susceptible to Ground moves and Arena Trap. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary.

Thousand Arrows can hit Pokémon using Fly or Bounce and will bring them back down to the ground, thus cancelling the moves. It can also hit Pokémon using Sky Drop but does not knock them to the ground. It does not knock down Substitutes but deals damage to the Substitute as normal.
When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thousand Arrows turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 180.

Thousand Waves.name: Thousand Waves
description: Thousand Waves deals damage and prevents the target(s) from fleeing or switching out, as long as the user remains in battle.
When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thousand Waves turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 175.

Land's Wrath.name: Land's Wrath
description: Land's Wrath deals damage with no additional effects.
When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Land's Wrath turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 185.

Diamond Storm.name: Diamond Storm
description: Diamond Storm deals damage and has a 50% chance of raising the user's Defense by two stages.
Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
In Generation 6, Diamond Storm has a 50% chance of raising the user's Defense by one stage.
When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Diamond Storm turns into Continental Crush and has base power 180.

Hyperspace Hole.name: Hyperspace Hole
description: Hyperspace Hole deals damage and always hits, even if the target used a Protect-like move.
It is the signature move of Hoopa.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyperspace Hole turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160.

Hyperspace Fury.name: Hyperspace Fury
description: Hyperspace Fury deals damage but lowers the user's Defense by one stage after attacking. The move always hits, even if the target used a Protect-like move.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Hyperspace Fury is the signature move of Hoopa Unbound.
When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyperspace Fury turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 180.

Steam Eruption.name: Steam Eruption
description: Steam Eruption deals damage and has a 30% chance of burning the target.
Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.
When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Steam Eruption turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 185.

Spirit Shackle.name: Spirit Shackle
description: Spirit Shackle deals damage and prevents the target from switching out, while the user remains in battle.
When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spirit Shackle turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 160.
When Decidueye is holding Decidium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spirit Shackle turns into Sinister Arrow Raid and has base power 180.

Triple Arrows.name: Triple Arrows
description: The user delivers an axe kick, then fires three arrows. This raises the chance of its future attacks landing critical hits and also lowers the target’s defensive stats.

Beak Blast.name: Beak Blast
description: The user first heats up its beak, and then it attacks the target. Making direct contact with the Pokémon while it's heating up its beak results in a burn.
When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Beak Blast turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 180.

Ice Hammer.name: Ice Hammer
description: The user swings and hits with its strong, heavy fist. It lowers the user's Speed, however. (100% chance)
When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Hammer turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 180.

Revelation Dance.name: Revelation Dance
description: Revelation Dance deals damage with a different type depending on the style of Oricorio:
Baile Style - Fire
Pom-Pom Style - Electric
Pa'u Style - Psychic
Sensu Style - Ghost
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Revelation Dance turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 175.

Accelerock.name: Accelerock
description: Accelerock deals damage and has high priority.
Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.
When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Accelerock turns into Continental Crush and has base power 100.

Spike Cannon.name: Spike Cannon
description: Spike Cannon hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.
Each strike of Spike Cannon is treated like a separate attack:
Each strike can get a critical hit independently.
Abilities that activate on contact (Static, Weak Armor, Iron Barbs etc.) activate for each strike.
If the Sturdy ability, Focus Sash, or Focus Band activates before the final hit, the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the opponent to faint.
If the first hit breaks a Substitute, the second hit will deal damage to the target Pokémon.
The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.
The Skill Link ability will cause Spike Cannon to always hit the maximum number of times.
In Generations 2-4, if a Focus Sash or Focus Band activates before the final hit, subsequent hits do not cause the holder to faint.
In Generations 1-3, Spike Cannon ends immediately if any hit breaks a Substitute.
In Generation 1, each hit will always deal the same damage - if the first critical hits, so will the rest.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spike Cannon turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

Baneful Bunker.name: Baneful Bunker
description: Baneful Bunker prevents any attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. If a contact move is targeted at the Baneful Bunker user on that turn, the attacker becomes poisoned. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves.

Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned. The effects do not stack with the Rocky Helmet item or the Rough Skin or Iron Barbs abilities.
The accuracy of Baneful Bunker drops by 1⁄3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect, Detect, Endure, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, or King's Shield.
When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Baneful Bunker turns into Z-Baneful Bunker and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Trop Kick.name: Trop Kick
description: Trop Kick deals damage and lowers the target's Attack by one stage.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Trop Kick turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 140.

Floral Healing.name: Floral Healing
description: The user restores the target's HP by up to half of its max HP. It restores more HP when the terrain is grass.
When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Floral Healing turns into Z-Floral Healing and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Instruct.name: Instruct
description: Instruct tells the user's teammate in a double/triple battle to use its most recent move instead of them. In other words, it allows a teammate to attack twice instead of the two Pokémon attacking once each.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Instruct turns into Z-Instruct and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Shore Up.name: Shore Up
description: The user regains up to half of its max HP. It restores more HP in a sandstorm.
When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shore Up turns into Z-Shore Up and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Purify.name: Purify
description: The user heals the target's status condition. If the move succeeds, it also restores the user's own HP.
When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Purify turns into Z-Purify and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Multi-Attack.name: Multi-Attack
description: Multi-Attack is the signature move of Silvally. It deals damage with its type matching the Memory item held.
In Generation 7, Multi-Attack has 90 base power.
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Multi-Attack turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 185.

Shell Trap.name: Shell Trap
description: Shell Trap sets a trap at the beginning of the turn, and if the user is hit by a physical move during the turn, it deals high damage to the opponent.
When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shell Trap turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 200.

Zing Zap.name: Zing Zap
description: May cause flinching. (30% chance)
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Zing Zap turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 160.

Anchor Shot.name: Anchor Shot
description: The user entangles the target with its anchor chain while attacking. The target becomes unable to flee.
When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Anchor Shot turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 160.

Clanging Scales.name: Clanging Scales
description: Clanging Scales deals damage but lowers the user's Defense by one stage after attacking.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Clanging Scales turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 185.
When Kommo-o is holding Kommonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Clanging Scales turns into Clangorous Soulblaze and has base power 185.

Clangorous Soul.name: Clangorous Soul
description: Raises all user's stats but loses HP. (100% chance)

Nature's Madness.name: Nature's Madness
description: Halves the foe's HP.
When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Nature's Madness turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 100.
When a Tapu is holding Tapunium Z and uses its Z-Power, Nature's Madness turns into Guardian of Alola.

Sunsteel Strike.name: Sunsteel Strike
description: Ignores the target's ability.
When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sunsteel Strike turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 180.
When Solgaleo or Dusk Mane Necrozma is holding Solganium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sunsteel Strike turns into Searing Sunraze Smash and has base power 200.

Moongeist Beam.name: Moongeist Beam
description: Ignores the target's ability.
When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Moongeist Beam turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 180.
When Lunala or Dawn Wings Necrozma is holding Lunalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Moongeist Beam turns into Menacing Moonraze Maelstrom and has base power 200.

Photon Geyser.name: Photon Geyser
description: Photon Geyser deals damage, but uses either the user's Attack or Special Attack stat to determine its power, whichever is higher.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Photon Geyser turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 180.
When Ultra Necrozma is holding Ultranecrozium Z and uses its Z-Power, Photon Geyser turns into Light That Burns the Sky and has base power 200.

Prismatic Laser.name: Prismatic Laser
description: The user shoots powerful lasers using the power of a prism. The user can't move on the next turn.
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Prismatic Laser turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 200.

Fleur Cannon.name: Fleur Cannon
description: Fleur Cannon deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fleur Cannon turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 195.

Spectral Thief.name: Spectral Thief
description: The user hides in the target's shadow, steals the target's stat boosts, and then attacks.
When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spectral Thief turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 175.
When Marshadow is holding Marshadium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spectral Thief turns into Soul-Stealing 7-Star Strike and has base power 195.

Rolling Kick.name: Rolling Kick
description: Rolling Kick deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).
Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rolling Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120.

Mind Blown.name: Mind Blown
description: Mind Blown deals damage, but the user sacrifices 1⁄2 of its maximum HP in recoil.
It can be learnt by UB Burst.
When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mind Blown turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 200.

Plasma Fists.name: Plasma Fists
description: Changes Normal-type moves to Electric-type moves.
When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Plasma Fists turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 180.

Double Iron Bash.name: Double Iron Bash
description: Double Iron Bash deals damage, will strike twice (with 60 base power each time), and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Double Iron Bash turns into Corkscrew Crash.

Drum Beating.name: Drum Beating
description: Lowers opponent's Speed. (100% chance)

Pyro Ball.name: Pyro Ball
description: May burn opponent. (10% chance)

Court Change.name: Court Change
description: Swaps the effects on either side of the field.

Snipe Shot.name: Snipe Shot
description: Ignores moves and abilities that draw in moves. High critical hit ratio.

Stuff Cheeks.name: Stuff Cheeks
description: The user eats its held Berry, then sharply raises its Defense stat. (100% chance)

Jaw Lock.name: Jaw Lock
description: Prevents user and opponent from switching out.

Tar Shot.name: Tar Shot
description: Lowers the opponent's Speed and makes them weaker to Fire-type moves. (100% chance)

Grav Apple.name: Grav Apple
description: Lowers the opponent's Defense stat. (100% chance)

Apple Acid.name: Apple Acid
description: Lowers target's Special Defense. (100% chance)

Overdrive.name: Overdrive
description: Hits all adjacent opponents.

Octolock.name: Octolock
description: Octolock prevents the target from fleeing or switching out, while the user remains in battle. It also lowers the target's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each every turn.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Teatime.name: Teatime
description: Forces all Pokémon on the field to eat their berries.

Magic Powder.name: Magic Powder
description: Changes target's type to Psychic.

False Surrender.name: False Surrender
description: Ignores Accuracy and Evasiveness.

Spirit Break.name: Spirit Break
description: Spirit Break deals damage and lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Obstruct.name: Obstruct
description: Obstruct prevents any attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. If a contact move is targeted at the user on that turn, the attacker's Defense is lowered by two stages.
Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Meteor Assault.name: Meteor Assault
description: User must recharge next turn.

Decorate.name: Decorate
description: Sharply raises target's Attack and Special Attack. (100% chance)

No Retreat.name: No Retreat
description: Raises all stats but user cannot switch out. (100% chance)

Aura Wheel.name: Aura Wheel
description: Aura Wheel is the signature move of Morpeko. It deals damage, but changes to Dark type when Morpeko is in Hangry Mode.

Bolt Beak.name: Bolt Beak
description: If the user attacks before the target, the power of this move is doubled.

Fishious Rend.name: Fishious Rend
description: If the user attacks before the target, the power of this move is doubled.

Dragon Darts.name: Dragon Darts
description: Dragon Darts deals damage and hits twice. In a double battle, it hits each opponent once.
Dragon Darts is the signature move of Dragapult.

Dynamax Cannon.name: Dynamax Cannon
description: Damage doubles if opponent is Dynamaxed.

Eternabeam.name: Eternabeam
description: User can't move on the next turn.

Wicked Blow.name: Wicked Blow
description: Always results in a critical hit and ignores stat changes.

Surging Strikes.name: Surging Strikes
description: Always results in a critical hit and ignores stat changes.

Jungle Healing.name: Jungle Healing
description: Restores team's HP and cures status conditions.

Thunder Cage.name: Thunder Cage
description: Deals damage and traps opponent, damaging them for 4-5 turns.

Dragon Energy.name: Dragon Energy
description: The higher the user's HP, the higher the power.

Glacial Lance.name: Glacial Lance
description: The user attacks by hurling a blizzard-cloaked icicle lance at opposing Pokémon.

Astral Barrage.name: Astral Barrage
description: The user attacks by sending a frightful amount of small ghosts at opposing Pokémon.

Stone Axe.name: Stone Axe
description: The user swings its stone axes at the target, aiming to land a critical hit. Stone splinters left behind by this attack continue to damage the target for several turns.

Dire Claw.name: Dire Claw
description: The user lashes out at the target with ruinous claws, aiming to land a critical hit. This may also leave the target poisoned, paralyzed, or drowsy.

Springtide Storm.name: Springtide Storm
description: Springtide Storm deals damage. If Enamorous is in Incarnate Forme, it also boosts its Attack and Defense; if the Enamorous is in Therian Forme, it lowers the target's Attack and Defense.
